loans.name: Judith Morayma

texts.es:
JUDITH MORAYMA TIENE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE CUATRO HIJOS Y UN NIETO, ELLA VIVE CON LOS HIJOS Y EL NIETO EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RÍOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC. VENTANILLA NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

JUDITH MORAYMA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CERDOS. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR 5 CERDOS Y LA ALIMENTACIÓN CÓMO POLVILLO PARA EL ANIMAL. cON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS CERDOS PARA CRIARLOS Y PODER VENDERLOS EN UN BUEN  PRECIO. 
LAS COMPRAS LAS HARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS. EL SUEÑO ES SEGUIR MEJORANDO EL TRABAJO PARA EL BIENESTAR DE LA FAMILIA.
EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA REALIZAR LOS QUEHACERES DOMESTICOS.
texts.en:
JUDITH MORAYMA is 48 years old and is the single mother of four children and one nephew.  They all live in Ventanas within the Rios province.

She is a member of the VENTANILLA NORTE community group, located in northern Ventanilla.  Residents farm and raise livestock.

JUDITH MORAYMA raises and sells pigs.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy five pigs and feed.  This loan will help her buy the pigs so she can raise them and resell them at a good price.

She will make her purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to continue improving her family’s wellbeing.

She likes to do household chores in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
Тамара замужем, имеет двоих детей. Вот уже 6 лет, как у Тамары есть свой бизнес. Она шьет одежду по индивидуальным заказм. Начинать бизнес было сложно, надо было завоевывать доверие клиентов. Сейчас, дела идут хорошо. У Тамары много заказов. Тамара хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше, чтобы он стал основным источником дохода семьи, мечтает переехать в большой город, чтобы растить там детей и заниматься любимым делом.
Тамара просит предоставить кредит для покупки ободурования - оверлока.
texts.en:
Tamara is married and has two children. For the past six years, Tamara has had her own business. She sews clothes by individual orders. 

Starting a business was difficult and it was necessary to win the trust of her customers. Now things are going well. Tamara has many orders. 

Tamara wants to develop her business further, in order to become the main source of income for the family. She dreams of moving to the big city to raise her children there and to do what she likes.  
 
Tamara is requesting a loan to buy an Overlock sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy Overlock sewing equipment

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en: Tetee is 47 years old and lives in Air Port, married with five children between the ages of 14 and 20. She has been selling rice and oil in the local market. Tetee started this business with money given to her by her mother. She appreciates the money she earns from her business every day and is now requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. Tetee hopes to improve her children's education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Githagara Women Group

texts.en:
Mary, Hellen, and Selina are group leaders of Githagara Women's Group, which is based in Kiambu. They have been with VEP since 2010 and have worked to purchase two dairy cows each. The dairy cows generate daily income for the women, allowing them to put their children through school.

They have approached VEP to supply them with 70 cookstoves, which they can sell to other women in their community as an income generating activity. Their aim is to have a distribution shop for both charcoal and firewood energy saving cookstoves.

Alongside the cookstoves they will also sell charcoal and pieces of firewood to create a one-stop shop for their customers. This business will generate consistent income to repay the loan and meet their families' needs.

loans.use: To purchase efficient cook stoves for sale

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She describes herself as a dependable and trustworthy woman. For the past eight years, Theresia has operated a beauty salon where she provides hair services such as blowdry, plaiting, and other services. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. Theresia's biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving her business. 

Theresia is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy beauty products. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Theresia's business goal is to expand her business and run a large cosmetics shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to provide hair services at her beauty salon

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a Mexican artisan who recycles auto, bike and motorbike parts, as well as discarded metal, into admirable sculptures. To continue his art work, he would like to invest in the purchase of welding tools.

Armando has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I grew up in a Mexican town famed for its traditional artistry, and I dreamed of creating something new. As a child I enjoyed inventing toys, and soon yearned to create a unique style of art. Environmentally conscious, I now transform recycled goods. I began to craft figures from scrap and discarded mechanical parts, mostly from cars and bicycles. Thanks to the creativity that God gave me, today I have an enjoyable and better way of life."

"Thank you for expressing your real and sincere commitment to our progress as artisans. This microcredit helps us forge ahead through difficult times."

Use the link below to view Armando's recycled metal sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4923

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of welding tools to continue his artwork.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Hannah is 30 years old and lives in Airport. She is married and has a two-year-old child. For the past four years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother, and she learned the business from her oldest sister. Hannah is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She hopes to become an international businesswoman in the near future and to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is an entrepreneur who has made progress towards his goals thanks to his capacity for work and his love for his family, which consists of his three children. He owns a business through which he generates income for his family. For the past 12 years, Stephen has sold green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions. Little by little, he has been able to expand his products and he currently sells other distinctive farm produce and has a domestic market made up of his neighbors, many of them working. However, Stephen's working capital has often been insufficient to meet his goals of improving his prosperity.

Stephen is requesting his first Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. He will be able to get substantial discounts by buying in volume. Stephen's dream is to grow and expand his market and this will be the groundwork for the success of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old and is married with six children who are all in school. He is a farmer who produces milk, maize, and beans for the local market. Joseph's biggest business challenges include inadequate rain, the lack of local organized markets, and the high cost of production.

Joseph is requesting a 36,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He will use the income generated with his loan to take care of his family as well as boost his farming business.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has five children between 14 and 25. They attend school and live at home. For three years she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, and other items. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper and other items. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper and other items for her business,

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 38 years old, married, and lives in Airport. She stopped her education at grade two. For the past 10 years, she has been selling dried bush meat in the local market. She established this business with small loans from her father. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried meat for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dried meat for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 28, is living with her friend at Sinkor. She has two children, ages 3 and 9, who are in school. Her 
education ended in the 7th grade. 

She learn to sell from her mother, and she first started by selling mineral water. 

She now has a table in the market where she sells palm oil, cooking oil, pepper, onion, Vita, salt, and
many other items. She is proud of her business because, with the profit generated, she attends
to the needs of her children and buys more goods to improve her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, cooking oil, palm oil, Vita, and onion to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, cooking oil, palm oil, Vita, and onion to resell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is 30 years old and lives in Airport. She is single and has two children who are 1 and 6 years old. One of her children is in school, and both of them live at home. For the past six years she has been operating a table in the local market where she sells chicken feet, pigs' feet, etc. She has a lot of customers. She makes a lot of money, which is helping her to look after her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken feet and pigs' feet, etc. for her business. In the future she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feet and pig's feet

loans.name: Effort

texts.en: Effort is 46 years old and Lives in Airport. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have four children between the ages of 6 and 30 years old. Three of them live at home and attend school. For the past 20 years, she has been selling alcoholic drinks in the local market, she gets a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks, such as big apple and white spirit, for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks, such as big apple and white spirit, for her business,

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 34 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 15 and 13 years old. She had to stop her education at the fourth grade, but is committed to get her children a good education. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by selling used clothing in a local market. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers, and the profit she earns helps her buy food for her family, She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothing to sell. In the future, she plans to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 54 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 19 and 35. For the past 23 years she has been selling dried fish. A problem she faces is getting wood to dry the fish. She started her business by selling cassava. She learned her business from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish to dry. Her plans are to build a cook shop, send her children to school, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to dry

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 49 years old and lives in Airport. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have five children between the ages of 13 and 33. Four live at home and two are married. For the past 25 years, Sarah has been operating a business selling pepper, oil, bitter ball, vita, etc. She started this business with 500 Liberian dollars. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, fish, bitter ball, vita and other items for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, fish, bitter ball,vita and other items for her business.

loans.name: Lorwo

texts.en: Lorwo is 39 years old, married, and lives in Airport with her husband and children. All her children are in school and are between the ages of 6 and 20. For 20 years she has been selling rice by the cup in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. A problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 55 years old, lives in Airport and has three children between 21 and  34 years old. They attend school and live on their own. Her husband is a contractor. For the past 27 years, she has been selling rice-bread (an African bread made of banana and rice) in the market. She is respected in her family and also a mother in a supportive home.She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and bananas for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 46 years old, lives in Airport, is married and has three children between 2 and 21. Two are currently in school and live at home. For the past 20 years, she has been selling rice, oil and pepper in the market. She enjoy the profit-making from the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil and pepper. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Palominos perteneciente al Distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla Clorinda es la crianza de ganado ovino; el cual al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 07 años de experiencia en la ganadería.  Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia de 4.30 has, pero también conduce y representa las parcelas de sus hermanos, que en total son 10.a has de mango kent y por lo cual tiene crédito con Agrobanco. 
Clorinda desea construir un cerco perimétrico de ladrillo y un portón de fierro para su casa.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 4000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Clorinda, 53, is married and has no dependent children. She lives in her own home with her ​​husband. Their house is located in Caserío Palominos which belongs to the District of Tambogrande. They live in a rural area but they have light services.

Clorinda rears sheep, and sells them in the local market when they have reached the ideal weight and size. She has over 7 years of experience in livestock trades. Her husband is a farmer with his own plot of 4.30 hectares, and he also manages and represents his brothers' land, a total of 10 hectares. For this reason he has a loan with Agrobanco.  

Clorinda wants to build a brick perimeter wall and an iron gate for her house, which is why she is seeking a loan of 4000 soles with Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: to construct a brick perimeter wall with an iron gate for her home.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. For the last two years, he has earned a living by running a food cafe. He supplements his income by selling charcoal. 

Duncan learned about Milango through friends who invited him to join the group, and he hopes that his membership will allow him to access credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal weather and securing all the supplies he needs for his cafe. He is applying for a loan for 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy supplies such as cooking oil, soap and flour. The extra income he earns as a result of getting this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees. In the future, he plans to go into business at a second location.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his cafe.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah lives in the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single mother of a one child in school.  She owns a clothes business that she has been operating for two years. Priscillah has been hawking the clothes to the nearby homes.

Priscillah learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.   She joined with the aim of obtaining credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are lack of funds and competition.  

Priscillah is applying for a loan of KES 31,450 to buy additional stock of second-hand clothes and shoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her savings. Her dream is to open a cosmetics business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child in school. He owns a transport business that he has been operating for one year. This mode of transport is greatly preferred because of the bad road network, which is not accessible by vehicles.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group.   He joined with the aim of obtaining credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel prices, seasonal weather, and finding customers.

Thomas is applying for a loan of KES 8,250 to add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand his business. His dream is to see his business grow and buy another motorbike to boost his transport business.

loans.use: To add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a green grocer, a business which she has been operating for two years.

Rachael learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of sufficient funds. 

Rachael is applying for a loan of 21,950 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruit wholesale. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children and improve her family's living standards. Her dream is to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 48 years old and lives in Airport. She stopped her education in 8th grade, and is now married with three children between 15 and 34. Two of her children live with her and go to school. For the past 25 years she has been selling soap in the local market. She is facing a shortage of goods. Mama likes her business because it provides for her needs. Her husband sells along with her. Mama is requesting a loan to purchase soap to expand their business. Her plan is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 38 years old and lives in Air Port. She is married with four children between 2 and 18. They live at home and attend school. For the past five years Rebecca has been running a table market where she sells dry fish. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. Rebecca appreciates her business because it helps her save every day and makes her popular. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married with four children. He owns a food cafe which he has been operating for ten years.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are debts and high transportation and fuel costs. 

Simion is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to buy cooking oil, cereals and wheat flour. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and improve on his living standards. His dream is to open another food cafe.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, cereals and wheat flour.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. She owns a transport business, which she has been operating for one year. This mode of transport is greatly preferred because of the bad road network, which is not accessible by vehicles. Besides this, she also sells charcoal.

Frida learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high transport and fuel prices, seasonal weather and finding customers. Frida is applying for a loan of 96,600 KES to purchase another motorcycle. Her dream is to see this business grow and to buy a three-wheeled vehicle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a dairy farmer who lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She has been in business for the last five years and is the mother of nine children. She went into business by using the money she received from selling a piece of family land to buy a dairy cow. She kept the cow until it gave birth and then been selling its milk. Because she now sees potential in raising livestock, she would like to diversity into poultry farming.

Mary was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan for 104,800 Kenyan shillings to buy chicks and chicken feed. The main challenges she faces are clients not paying on time and the high cost of transportation. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her livestock herd because she believes that this will help her pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electronic gadgets to expand operations in his shop.

loans.name: Tauala Feagai

texts.en:
Tauala is a 56-year-old married woman, with 11 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tauala has requested a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to expand her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. 

With her profits, Tauala hopes to save  for family needs.

loans.use: To buy shovels, bush knives, gloves, and weed killer.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a retail shop for selling juice, bottled water, sweets, etc., and her business has been operating for two years. Saada started the business through her personal savings. 

Saada learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.  She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Saada is applying for a loan of KES 21,100 Kenya to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, water, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her repay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, and water.

loans.name: Matafale

texts.en:
"Matafale is a 38-year-old married woman, with three children. 

She would like to start growing taro plants and banana trees to earn a living. Matafale has requested a loan to buy crops, a plant sprayer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a bush knife, and barbed wire for her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Matafale will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and other tools to grow taro and bananas.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married, has one child and earns a living as a green grocer. She has been in this line of work for three years and sells, in addition to greens, flour, cooking oil and other items. 

Regina learned about Milango through a friend and joined because she hopes to improve her business operations. The main challenges she faces are price fluctuations and inflation, securing enough items to sell and a seasonal business climate. She is applying for a loan for 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetable and fruits wholesale. She will combine the extra income she earns from this loan with her savings to expand her business. Her plans for the future are to start another businesses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale.

loans.name: Moli

texts.en: Moli is 21 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by running a small plantation where she grows vegetables to sell. She has been doing this for three years, and is requesting a loan to buy seeds and a rake, wheelbarrow, water hose and gloves for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010 and plans to use her profits to expand her business in the future and save more money to use educating her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and a rake, wheelbarrow, water hose and gloves.

loans.name: Toe

texts.en:
Toe is a 62-year-old married woman, with eight children. 

She would like to start growing cabbages, carrots, and cucumbers to earn a living. Toe has requested a loan to buy seeds for cucumbers, cabbages, and tomatoes, plus a rake, gloves, and a water hose to start her business. 

She is a new member of SPBD. Toe will spend her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cucumber, cabbages, and tomato seeds, a rake, gloves, and a water hose.

loans.name: Faasootala

texts.en:
Faasootala is 57 years old and married, with seven children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro plants and banana trees and then sells the harvest in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Faasootala needs a loan to buy taro crops, a rake, a bush knife, a wheelbarrow, and barbed wire for her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since last year. Faasootala will use the profits from her sales to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy taro crops, a rake, a bush knife, a wheelbarrow, and barbed wire.

loans.name: Meaalofa

texts.en:
Meaalofa is 40 years old and married, with six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cake in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy sugar, foam cups, coolio, and a small deep freezer to start her own business at home. In the future, Meaalofa hopes to expand her business at the end of this year.  She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, foam cups, coolio, and a small deep freezer.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is 27 years old and single, with no children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, yeast, and baking soda so she can start a business. 

In the future, Maota hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil, yeast, and baking soda.

loans.name: Asoono

texts.en: Asoono is 41 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, chicken leg quarters, lamb flaps, flour, sugar, soap, etc. She has been doing this for four years. Asoono needs a loan to purchase more goods to expand her shop. She hopes to use her profits to save for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, salts, onions and snacks.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Cristina is married and has four children. To make a living, she has made and sold food for seven years and earns about 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Cristina is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en:
Victorino is a business-oriented man, married to a teacher, and has three children. His previous source of income came from his photography business. When he was in high school, he loved to take photos, so he developed his skills in photography because he knew it could help him a lot.

Victorino has managed his livestock for two years and his fishpond for five years. Over the years, his fishpond business grew, as well as his expertise in his rice field and his photography business. However, his photography business has started to go downhill due to many competitors and the new modern gadgets used by most people. 

Despite his situation, he understands that he can't always have a consistent level of profit. With regards to this, he hasn't lost hope for a recovery of his profits. Instead, he has made a new beginning because he believes he can make it more productive and profitable. This principle pushes him to strive hard to be able to overcome his trials in life.

Victorino is requesting a loan of PHP50,000, allowing him to buy livestock feed, vitamins and vaccines to ensure the proper growth of his hogs. He knows that this amount would really be of great help. He is hoping for approval of this amount to be able to increase his profit, which will enable him to educate his three children and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed, vitamins and vaccines to ensure the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Tungalagtamir

texts.en: Tungalagtamir, who is 43 years old, lives with her husband and son in a small house in Arhangai province. Her husband operates a business transporting and selling coal. Her son becomes a college student this year. She and her husband sell coal to residents of Ulaanbaatar in the winter, and their profit is 1,000,000 mnt. In the summer, they transport goods between Ulaanbaatar city and Arhangai province, and their profit is 350,000 mnt. Last year they repaired their house with their business profit. Now they are requesting a 3,800,000 mnt loan to pay their son's college fee.

loans.use: To pay their son's college fee

loans.name: Justino Adolfo

texts.es: Justino de  46 anos de edad, en unión libre, con un hijo de 9 anos pertenece al municipio de Chinandega. Chinandega es un lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial prospera, es una zona fronteriza que facilita el comercio en Chinandega. Justino tiene por actividad económica prestar el servicio de taxi, el cual tiene 16 anos brindando este servicio en la ciudad de Chinandega, a clientes fijos como trabajadores de empresa y otros eventuales. La unidad de taxi al adquirió hace varios anos con esfuerzo propio porque estaba trabajando fuera del país y con el dinero que trajo pudo comprar su unidad de taxi que hasta la fecha ha sido su medio de vida  y de su familia. Justino ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 el cual  ha demostrado ser responsable, buena pago, en tiempo y forma. Los desafíos y problemas que ha enfrentado  la familia en le negocio son algunos desperfectos mecánicos que presenta el motor de su unidad de taxi por lo cual esta solicitando el préstamo. Su sueno en un futuro es seguir trabajando duro y llegar a comprar otra unidad de taxi. Justino agradece la ayuda que brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recurso de países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Justino is 45 years old. He's in a common law marriage and has a 9-year-old son. He comes from the town of Chinandega. Chinandega is known as a thriving commercial area; it's a border area, which facilitates the trade in Chinandega. Justino's business is taxi services, which he has been providing for 12 years in the town of Chinandega. He has both casual and regular customers, such as company employees. He acquired his taxi cab many years ago as a result of his own efforts. He had been working abroad, and with the money he brought back he was able to purchase his taxi, which has been his and his family's livelihood. Justino has already worked with Fundación León 2000 before, and he has proven himself to be responsible with his repayments, both in terms of time and form. The challenges and hardships that the family has faced in the business are a few mechanical flaws in the engine of his taxi, which is the reason why he's requesting the loan. His dream for the future is to keep on working hard and eventually buy another taxi cab. Justino gives thanks for the help that Kiva lenders provide for underprivileged people from poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his taxi cab.

loans.name: Ronela

texts.en:
Ronela is from Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old and married, with two children. 

To make a living, she manages a planting and harvesting of seaweed for sale. She's engaged in her business for five years and earns PHP 3,000 a month for these activities. In 2011, Ronela joined GDMPC. 

Ronela is requesting a loan of PHP 3,500 that will be used to buy seedlings and twine to expand the business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and twine to expand her business.

loans.name: Virgillia

texts.en:
Virgillia is a widow. She is 53 years old and resides at Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. 

Virgillia owns and operates a general store to earn a living, and she's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,500 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. Virgillia been a member of GDMPC since 2009. 

In the future, Virgillia wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shovels, bush knives, spades and weed killer

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old and married with eight children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, sugar, soft-drinks, canned goods and other grocery items.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rosemarie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, sugar, soft-drinks, canned goods and other grocery items.

loans.name: Faitele

texts.en: Faitele is a 43-year-old single woman with one child. She would like to start growing cabbages and tomatoes to earn a living. Faitele has requested a loan to start a new vegetable garden. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Faitele will save her profits in her account for family needs.

loans.use: to buy shovels, bush knives, a grass cutter, and gloves.

loans.name: Estilito

texts.en: Estilito is married with one child. Estilito is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. To earn a living, Estilito has been operating a service-based business for seven years, and every month he earns 5,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of 8,500 to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Estilito been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Estilito hopes to double his income to sustain the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jael

texts.es: Jael de 36 años de edad, del departamnento de chinandega, que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del pais. Jael siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora responsable,ella ya ha trabajado con fundacion y ha demostrado ser muy buena  paga en tiempo y forma , Jael tiene por actividad economica la venta de meracaderia en general que consisten en vender cosmeticos variados , ropa, zapatos. Y distribuye  su mercaderia de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Jael es de 10 horas desde la 8: am hasta las 6:pm   Cuenta con 4 años de tener el negocio , el cual inicio este negocio como una forma de subsistencia para su familia. En la actualidad ha obtenido logros y ha podido cumplir sus suenos como es tener una vivienda propia producto de su esfuerzo y el apoyo que le brindan  los inversionista kiva a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno. El fnancimiento lo esta solicitando  para invertir en la compra de cosmeticos, zapatos, y ropa en general. Agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionista kiva a los pequenos comerciantes para tener un medio de trabajo propio para poder sobrevivir con sus familias en un pais que tiene tantas carencias y falta de recursos para nuestro futuras generaciones.
texts.en: Jael is 36 years old and from the state of Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country. Jael has always been known as a responsible and hardworking woman.  She has worked with integrity and has proven to be a very good payer in a timely manner.  Jael's economic activity is the sale of general merchandise, which consists of selling various cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.  She also distributes her merchandise as a street peddler. Jael's daily routine is 10 hours long, from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She has had the business for 4 years, after starting it to secure a livelihood for her family. Currently she has achieved her goals, and has been able to fulfill her dream of home ownership, which was a product of her effort and the support given to her by the investors at Kiva and to poor people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a decent working environment. She seeks a loan to invest in cosmetics, shoes, and clothing in general.  She appreciates the assistance the investors at Kiva give to small businesses in order to have a proper working environment to survive with their families in a country with a great deal of shortcomings and lack of resources for future generations.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase and sale of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is 29 years old and is married with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling BBQ in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to start her business. In the future, Carol hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chickens, sausages, mutton flaps, soya, etc. for her BBQ business.

loans.name: Ma. Rolita

texts.en:
Ma. Rolita is 54 years old and married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits (cookies), soft-drinks and beverages to sell.

Ma. Rolita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling coconut vinegar.

Ma. Rolita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, soft-drinks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en:
This is Aguida, 73, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is already a widow. With the help of her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Aguida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Aguida hopes her business would continue to grow so she wouldn’t be a burden to her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: Gerónimo,31 años de edad, originario de la comarca Cusirisme en las afueras de Teustepe, de oficio agricultor , tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa siendo el quien mantiene a su familia. Se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y trigo desde los 15 años junto con su papa. Actualmente tiene 5 años de trabajar por cuenta propia, tiene su caballo y bomba para fumigar sus cultivos y protegerlos en contra de las plagas, un trabajador que le ayuda en las labores del campo. Cuando la temporada de siembra es baja, viaja al vecino País Costa Rica a trabajar en las fincas cortando café, lo que gana lo invierte en su hogar y en las siembras. La mayoría de su producción la vende en su misma comarca. Él requiere el financiamiento para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar frijol y maíz. Una vez que el cancele su crédito le gustaría comprar un terreno para ampliar más sus áreas de siembra ya que el área que posee es  poco y el desea seguir sembrando más para poder responderle a las necesidades y bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Geronimo is 31 years old, is a native of the Cusirisme region outside of Teustepe, is a farmer by trade, and he has a son who is three years old. His wife is a homemaker and he works to support the family. He grows corn, beans, and wheat and has been doing so since the age of 15 when he worked alongside his father. Now he has been working for himself for five years. He has a horse and a pump which he uses to fumigate his crops and protect them against pests, and he has a worker who helps him in the fields. When the planting season is low, he travels to neighboring Costa Rica to work on other farms cutting coffee. He invests what he earns in his home and in his own crops. The majority of his produce he sells locally. He needs the financing to purchase supplies and pay labor wages in order to plant beans and corn. Once he has paid off his loan, he would like to purchase a plot of land to increase his planting area. His current area is small and he hopes to continue farming more so that he will be able to attend to the needs and well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchas supplies and pay labor wages in order to sow beans and corn.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
This is Wilfreda, 55, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a driver and is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Wilfreda operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and then sells them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her inventory. 

Wilfreda hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to give her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Mayramkhon

texts.ru: Майрамхону 27 лет.  Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Майрамхон   решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mayramkhon is 27 years old. She is married and is raising three children. Her husband receives a small salary. This salary is not enough to provide the family with all the required means. 

Mayramkhon decided to help her husband for the family's wellbeing. To that end, she took the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now, she may well start her own business and become successful in this field. She wants to organize a business sewing women's clothing, because she has experience in this kind of work. She plans to use the revenue to provide her children with a good education and dense foods. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy a sewing machine, in order to establish a new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine for organizing new business

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en: Jannet is 34-year-old lady who lives in Airport with her husband and she has a 4 year old child who is in school. For ten years now she has been involved in the sale of fish in the local market. A friend helped her start the business. Jannet is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Marita

texts.es:
Marita tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Vive en casa propia, con conviviente e hijos menores . El Caserío donde vive junto a su familia es una comunidad alejada a unos 15 minutos de Tambogrande y no cuenta con servicios básicos. Comunidad dedicada a la actividad agrícola. 
La actividad que desarrolla Marita es la crianza de cerdos, aves de corral y a la cosecha de limón en parcela heredada de 0,5 ha. Su conviviente le ayuda en el cuidado de animales, apoyándolo en las actividades que realiza. Se dedica  al cultivo, cosecha de limón y  a la crianza hace aproximadamente mas de 10  años. 
Marita ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa, un crédito para el mantenimiento de cultivo de limón, mango en la compra de abono y la compra de alimento balanceado para animales. Para eso cliente cuenta con los conocimientos para el manejo de su cultivos y a la adecuada alimentación del ganado.
texts.en:
Marita is 39 years old. She has a partner and one dependent child. She lives in her own home with her partner and minor children. The village where she lives with her family is a remote agricultural community about 15 minutes from Tambogrande, and does not have basic services. 

Marita raises pigs, poultry, and lemon crops on half a hectare of land that she inherited. Her partner helps with animal care, supporting her in her activities. She has worked in the cultivation and harvest of lemons and the breeding of livestock for over 10 years.

Marita has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to maintain the cultivation of lemons, in the purchase of fertilizer and the purchase of balanced feed for the animals. For this, the client depends on the knowledge to manage her farming and the appropriate feeding of livestock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming and balanced feed for livestock.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel  tiene 60 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa, un lugar en el oeste de Nicaragua, conocido por su producción de caña y azúcar. Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.
El señor Manuel cuenta con un negocio de mini pulpería, Situada al costado oeste de su casa. Los fondos que se facilitaron en la institución CEPRODEL y Kiva fueron destinados para aumentar el inventario de mercadería de negocio. Actualmente, el negocio se maneja su hija porque el señor Manuel está sufriendo de una enfermedad, manifestándose sintomatología de dolores en sus extremidades además de cansío permanente, motivo por el cual dejo de laborar. Debido de que ha estado muy enfermo, su hija está administrando el negocio familiar. La enfermedad del señor Manuel impacto la familia de manera económica ya que dejo de percibir los ingresos directo de su fuente de empleo.
La causa de la enfermedad del señor Manuel supone que fue a causa por los años de trabajo en fábrica como operario de maquinaria. 
El señor Manuel está casado. Tuvo 4 hijos de los cuales 2 están bajo su responsabilidad, de los cuales 1 aun está estudiando.
El negocio lo inicio con fondos propios con ventas de golosinas, posteriormente, gracias al préstamo que adquirió con CEPRODEL, fue desarrollando un poco más su negocio hasta conseguir una estabilidad del mismo, ya que cuenta alrededor de 5 años de tenerlo establecido. 
El señor Manuel, se desempeñaba como electricista, generando ingresos extras a su familia.
El señor Manuel  manifestó que el los fondos que se dieron aumento los niveles de ventas en su negocio y que por ende aumento el ingreso familiar, dándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 60 years old.  He lives in the town of Chichigalpa, a place in the western part of Nicaragua known for its sugarcane and sugar production.  This is one of the warmest places in Nicaragua.

Manuel has a mini grocery store business located on the western side of his house.  He will use the funds from CEPRODEL and Kiva to increase the inventory of merchandise he has in his store.  The business is currently being run by his daughter, because Manuel suffers from an illness which is causing him a lot of pain in his extremities and constant fatigue.  This is why he stopped working.  Because he has been very ill, his daughter has been running the family business.  Manuel's illness has had a financial impact on his family, because he stopped directly earning income from his source of employment.  Manuel thinks that his illness was caused by his many years of working in a factory as a machine operator.

Manuel is married, and he has 4 children.  He is still responsible for 2 of them, 1 of whom is still in school.  Manuel started his business with his own capital, selling candy.  Later, thanks to a loan that he got from CEPRODEL, he developed his business a bit more until it became stable.  He has had this business running now for 5 years.

Manuel used to work as an electrician, generating extra income for his family.

Manuel states that the loans that he has been given have increased the level of sales in his business.  As a result the family's income has increased, giving them a better quality of life.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Manuel Antonio  from Nicaragua

loans.use: to invest in inventory for his business, including: candy, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen, 32, is the mother of three children.  She is married and lives at west point. Her children are between the ages of 4 and 16. Her husband is a businessman and he helped her with the initial capital to start her business. 

Moreen has been selling coal at retail prices in the community market for the past six years. One challenge she faces is the low volume of sales during the raining season.  She loves working in this business because she makes a profit. With the profit she generates, she can buy coal bags and resell them by retail and also contribute to covering her family's expenses.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more coal bags for her business.  Her plan for the future is to build house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal bags for her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon.  She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts and supplies needed in her shop. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Corazon would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts, supplies and do maintenance of her shop. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Corazon hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy spare parts and supplies for her appliance repair business

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years.

Rhea requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy tools and equipment

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion, 51 years old, is a married entrepreneur in Clain with 4 children.  He earns income from his transport service business. It was started almost 10 years now and he earns PHP 6,000 a month. To improve his business, Concepcion borrowed an amount of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC Micro Credit, which he just joined last 2011.  He used the loan to obtain accessories and tires. He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: buy motoricycle accessories and tires

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married mother of 1 child. She is 22 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Flordeliza owns and operates a transport business. She has been engaged in this type of service for 3 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

Flordeliza requested a loan of 7,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase accessories. Flordeliza been a good member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Flordeliza wants to purchase more rickshaws to use in her business.

loans.use: buy accessories for her rickshaw

loans.name: Jacklord

texts.en:
Jacklord works hard to support his family. He is married and has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. He has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from charcoal retail.

Jacklord requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for his tricycle.  In the future, he would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: buy tools and equipment

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, a married mother of two, is 31 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur where she owns farmland upon which she raises crops to make a living. She has been in business for 5 years and earns about 20,000 PHP each month.  Esmeralda joined GDMPC in 2009.

Esmeralda has requested a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting.  She is hoping that her business will grow.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 38 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Замира в качестве основного дохода  для своей семьи, с 2004 года занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке, стартовав с суммы 20,000 сом.  Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 20,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп одежды на предстоящий сезон – теплых кофт, курток и свитеров.  Доходы от кредита Замира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Zamira is 38 years old and married with two children. Zamira, as the main income earner for her family, since 2004 has been selling men's clothing at the market, starting with the amount of 20,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Zamira generates about 20,000 som per month, which is the basis to cover the cost of food and household needs for the family.

In order to further the development of her business, Zamira turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of clothes for the coming season – warm coats, jackets and sweaters. Zamira plans to invest in further expansion of its business with income from loan, in order to eventually build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
This is Claudia, 52, a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Florante, is self-employed and a mother to her  children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Claudia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Claudia also has a barber shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Claudia is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Claudia hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

Ingredients

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.ru:
Евгений  - фермер. С 2002 года занимается выращиванием картошки, редиски, огурца и моркови, а  также занимается томатами.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает жена, есть  двое маленьких детей, 8-ми и 5-ти лет. которые учатся в школе. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания ранней картошки, моркови и редиски в теплицах расположенных на 12 сотках земли .
Александр решил приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплиц, в которых он выращивает помидоры.
В планах на будущие:  построить несколько новых теплиц
В личных планах: покупка микроавтобуса для транспортировки товара на рынок.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки для теплицы.
texts.en:
Evgeniy is a farmer. Since 2002, he has been engaged in growing potatoes, radishes, cucumbers and carrots, as well as tomatoes. 
To manage the household he is helped by his wife. They have two small children, aged 5 and 8, who are studying at school. 

Development of activities began with growing early potatoes, carrots, and radishes in greenhouses on 12 acres of land. 

Evgeniy decided to buy film for covering greenhouses where he grows tomatoes. 

In the future, he plans to build more new greenhouses. On a personal note, he plans to purchase a van to transport goods to the market. 

He needs your help to finance the film for his greenhouses.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 57 years old and lives in Malibangcao Clarin Mis. Occ.  Lorna is married with 5 children. 

To earn a living, Lorna has a business selling snacks in the local community.  She earns about PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work.  

Lorna has requested a loan for additional capital for her business.  She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Lorna would like to expand her business through the help of our cooperative.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to earn a living.  She is married and has four grown-up children.  According to her, three of her children has been settled for marriage and are living separately, while the other one left is her helper in running her rice retail business.

Milagros would like to increase the sacks of rice she offers, but her capital is inadequate, so she requested for a loan of PHP 15,000. She hopes that she can avail herself of this loan amount in order to supply all her customers near her village and be able to satisfy their demands.  In this way, she can  get enough income for her family basic commodities.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
This is Irene, 63, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a mother to her children.  Irene, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Irene operates a room rental business. It is rented in a monthly basis. She also has a junk shop as a source of income. She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Irene is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. She expects a boost in her business income as she improves her business. 

Irene hopes to be able to have her renovation soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of her rental apartment

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru:
Айгул 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Айгул в качестве основного дохода  для своей семьи, после распада Союза, начала заниматься продажей обуви на рынке, стартовав практически с нуля.  Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 15,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи.  Доходы от бизнеса позволили Айгул увеличить деятельность за счет сельского хозяйства, в частности животноводства  - ее хозяйство насчитывает 15 овец.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул  обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп обуви на предстоящий сезон – теплых ботинок, сапог и утепленных тапок.  Доходы от кредита Айгул  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, часть доходов планирует направить в помощь постройки дома для сына.
texts.en:
Aigul is 44 years old and married with four children. Aigul, as the main income earner for her family, after the dissolution of the Soviet Union began selling shoes at the market, starting virtually from scratch. Thanks to her hard work, Aigul generates about 15,000 som per month, which is the basis to cover the cost of food and household needs for the family. Revenues from her business allowed Aigul to increase her involvement in agriculture, particularly animal husbandry - her flock consists of 15 sheep.

In order to further the development of her business, Aigul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of shoes for the upcoming season – warm shoes, insulated boots and sneakers.  Aigul plans to invest income from the loan in further expansion of her business and is planning to send a portion of the proceeds to help build a house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Almakul

texts.ru:
Алмакул  50 лет, мать 9 детей. Алмакул  в качестве основного дохода  для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 6,000 сом.  Благодаря упорному труду Алмакул, ее  деятельность приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Также Алмакул возделывает 4,90 га земли с пшеницей, фасолью, овощами и многолетними травами.  Доходы от бизнеса позволили Алмакул дать образование своим детям.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмакул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян пшеницы и минеральных удобрений, так как посев осенью позволяет получить более высокий урожай весной.  Доходы от кредита Алмакул  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, часть доходов планирует копить на обучение младшей дочери Сауле.
texts.en:
Almakul is 50 years old and the mother of nine children. As the main source of income for her family, Almakul has been engaged in raising livestock and growing crops since 2000, started with only 6,000 som (KGS). Through her hard work, her activity generates about 5,000 som monthly, which is the basis for covering the cost of food and household needs of the family. Almakul also cultivates 4.90 hectares of land with wheat, beans, vegetables, and perennials. 

Revenues from her business allowed Almakul to educate her children. In order to further develop her business, Almakul approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som for the purchase of wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers, since autumn sowing produces a better harvest in the spring. Almakul plans to invest income from the loan in further growth of her business. A part of the income is planned to be saved for the training of her youngest daughter Saule.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gregoire

texts.en:
Gregoire is 46 years old and is married with two children who are 7 and 14 years old. He sells various goods such as bread and tea, etc. from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. He employs two people to help him and has three years of experience.

Gregoire has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantity of  tea and bread for resale. He plans to use any profit generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs, to pay school fees for his children and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: buy tea and bread to sell

loans.name: Jules

texts.fr: Jules est un homme  femme de 34 ans célibataire, père de trois enfants dont l'age varie entre 07 et 15 ans. Il a ouvert un petit secrétariat bureautique qu'il gère depuis 10 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. Sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors il sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en ajoutant un mini ordinateur, une souris et un copieur pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront non seulement d'ajouter le petit matériel bureautique, mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins  quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Jules is a 34-year-old unmarried man and the father of three children, aged 7 to 15 years old. He opened a small business office that he has been running for ten years in a district in the capital. His customers are becoming more and more numerous, so he is requesting a loan to expand by adding a mini-computer, a mouse, and a copier, so as to be able to satisfy them and to increase his output. The profits derived will enable him not only to add various office equipment and supplies but also to meet the day-to-day needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a  mini-computer, a mouse, and a copier

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия жительница города Душанбе. Ей 42 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Зулфия имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. Зулфия арендует торговую точку, где занимается оптовой реализации товаров (одежды). Она воспитанная и приятная женщина. 
Зулфия просит кредит для покупки детской зимней одежды с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 42 years old, divorced, and has two children. Zulfiya has a teaching degree. She is engaged in trade in the market. 

Zulfiya rents a shop where she sells clothing wholesale. She is a well-mannered and pleasant woman. 

Zulfiya is asking for a loan to purchase children's winter clothing with the aim of increasing turnover.

loans.use: to buy children's winter clothing

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married mother of three children, two of  her children go to school.   She also takes care of her young brother.  She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for 3 years, selling to all categories of people, and works seven days a week at the market. 

Esther has applied for loan of 500000 Ugandan shilling from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, charcoal and rice.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big into a fully stocked restaurant and also to get enough profit to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Esther resides in a rented house.  Her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is the owner of a clothes selling store where she sells all kinds of clothing products. She has worked in this business for more than 3 years and so she already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from her.

Caroline is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.  She is requesting this loan to buy bales of clothes and more supplies to stock her business and to be able to offer good quality to her customers.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 58, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a widow. With the help of her children, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jocelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Jocelyn is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jocelyn hopes her business would continue to grow and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is married and has five children. She tells us that she has had a grocery store in the market for 8 years. It is well stocked. She is a very hard-working person, eager to succeed and help her family, as she knows that life is hard and working is the only way to get ahead.

Zipporah is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.  She is requesting a loan to buy fruits, vegetables and more supplies to stock her business and to be able to offer good quality to her customers.

loans.use: restock her grocery store

loans.name: Agnela

texts.en:
Agnela is married and has four children. She tells us that she has had a grocery store in her home for 7 years. It is well stocked. She is a very hard-working person, eager to succeed and help her family, as she knows that life is hard and working is the only way to get ahead.

Agnela is applying for a loan in order to buy green vegetables, fruits and tomatoes and other supplies that she wishes to supply her business with, and to continue providing good products to her customers.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Zahra buys vegetables that she later sells herself in various street markets and from home. She is a very hard-working, self-sacrificing woman because everything she does is to provide her family with the best. 

Zahra wants to expand her business to provide her family with a better standard of living. She requested this loan to expand vegetable offerings and to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and carrots.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is from Alindahaw, Tukuran. She is 41 years old and married with five children. To make a living, Jennifer has been running a general store for 2 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month from these activities. 

Jennifer is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Jennifer joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to pay the tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: María  Margarita de 45 anos de edad, casada, del departamento de Chinandega, con 5 hijos en las edades comprendidas de 26, 24, 22, 19,14. El hijo menor es el que esta bajo su responsabilidad porque esta estudiando y es menor de edad. María Margarita sus actividades económicas son: pulpería, molino, billares, y venta de cerdos. En el cual se ha desempeñado desde hace 28 anos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado e su casa de habitación. Negocio que lo aprendió hace muchos anos como trabajadora en una pulpería de una amiga, y luego con unos ahorros familiares inicio su propio negocio que en la actualidad ha sido su medio de vida. La Sra. María Margarita ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado ser responsable, buena paga en tiempo y forma. Con el financiamiento invertirá en capital de trabajo para surtir su pulpería y ofrecer mejor servicios a sus clientes. Ella necesita comprar granos básicos, jugos enlatados, jabón, leche, queso, cuajada. La Sra. agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Margarita, 45, is from the department of Chinandega.  She's married and has five children, ages 26, 24, 22, 19, and 14.  She's still responsible for the youngest child because he's a student and a minor.

María Margarita's economic activities are a store, a mill, pool, and pig sales.  Her business, which she has carried out for 28 years, is located in her house.  She learned it many years ago as a worker in a friend's store, and later she started her own business with some family savings.  Currently it's her means of support.

María Margarita has already worked with the foundation and has shown herself to be responsible.  She makes her payments punctually.
