With the loan she'll invest in working capital to stock her store and give her customers better service.  She needs to buy staples, canned juice, soap, milk, cheese, and curd.

She's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua for them to have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities to stock her store

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
For over two years in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Elma, a 32-year-old married mother of 1 child, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Recently, Elma joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Ngo Nyeheg

texts.fr: Leticia est une jeune femme de 28 ans mariée mère de famille . Elle est commerçante dans le domaine de la patisserie depuis 3 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et à la bonne qualité des gateaux proposés,et surtout aux prix pratiqués, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigente.La petitesse de son chiffre d' affaires ne lui permet plus de satisfaire les doléances variées de la clientele. en effet,ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter un sac de farine et les ingrédients afin de diversifier et augmenter les quantités des gateaux. ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiare Elle économisera une partie de ce bénéfice pour l'investir dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Leticia is a young woman, 28 years old, married, and a mother with a family. She has been a businesswoman in the domain of pastries for three years. Thanks to her warm welcomes and the good quality of the cakes she offers, and especially the practical prices, she has acquired a considerable customer base, which is more and more demanding. Her low sales no longer allow her to satisfy their various complaints. 

And so this loan will enable her to purchase a sack of flour and the ingredients for diversifying and increasing the number of cakes. This will increase her sales and thus her profit margin. She will save part of the profits to invest in her business, and the rest will help her to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour and ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Santo Niño, Tukuran. She is 55 years old. Erlinda is married and has two children. 

Erlinda owns and operates a business selling personal products such as lotions and perfumes in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Erlinda is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to buy additional products such as lipstick and makeup to sell. In 2008, Erlinda joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: buy personal products to resell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
This is Fernando, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Cherry Ann, a vendor, and is father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Fernando operates a coconut stand. He buys coconut that are native to the Philippines which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. He also sells other Filipino fruit staples. His regular customers are his neighbors and people in the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Fernando is requesting a PHP 50, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coconut to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Fernando dreams to grow his business in the coming years. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy coconut to resell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Since we're living in a modernized world, Anabelle decided to put up her Internet cafe and at the same time her restaurant business. She has run her Internet cafe and restaurant for three years.  For that long period of time she had devoted her time and is able to make her business grow and profitable.

Anabelle is married and has four children.  The couple works together to educate all their four children and give them a better way of living.  

Anabelle plans to purchase an additional unit of headset and a webcam, but her capital is not sufficient, so she requested a loan of PHP 15,000.  She hopes to obtain this loan amount because it is useful in her business development.

Anabelle is looking forward for the continuous development of her Internet cafe business to be able to have a stable source of income allowing her to educate all her children.

loans.use: buy a headset and webcam for her Internet cafe

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Aurelia es de la ciudad de Santaní, ella es una excelente comerciante, nos cuenta que tiene una despensa, pero que también se dedica a la producción y venta de leche. Comenta que por medio de estos negocios da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante y tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Aurelia solicitó el crédito para agrandar su salón de ventas debido a que su clientela ha crecido, ella agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada para poder crecer.
texts.en: Mrs. Aurelia is in the city Santaní, she is an excellent businesswoman, she tells us she has a store, but that she also produces and sells milk. She comments that because of these businesses she is able to give to her family that they need to succeed and have a dignified life without want. Aurelia is asking for a loan in order to expand her store because her clientele is growing and she is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have given her to grow.

loans.use: expand her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with 2 children.  She is 57 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. 

Rosemarie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been 11 years in this business.  Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In 2008, Rosemarie joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to finished the studies of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mareen

texts.fr: Mareen est une jeune femme de 30 ans mariée mère de famille . Elle est commerçante dans le domaine de la restauration depuis 4 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et à la bonne qualité des plats proposés,et surtout aux prix pratiqués, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigente.La petitesse de son chiffre d' affaires ne lui permet plus de satisfaire les doléances variées de la clientele. en effet,ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de denrées alimentaires (farine, palette de poisson et les fruits)les ingrédients)afin de diversifier et augmenter les quantités de ses denrées alimentaires entrant dans la composition de ses plats, de satisfaire sa clientèle mais aussi d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Mareen is a young woman, 30 years old, married, and a mother with a family. She has been a businesswoman in the restaurant domain for four years. Thanks to her warm welcomes and the good quality of the dishes she offers, and especially the practical prices, she has acquired a considerable customer base, which is more and more demanding. Her low sales no longer allow her to satisfy their various complaints. And so this loan will enable her to increase her stock of grocery items (flour, fish, and fruit), to diversify and increase the quality of ingredients that go into making her dishes, to satisfy her customers, and also to increase her profit margin. She will reinvest part of the profits in her business to expand it. The rest will help her to support her family.

loans.use: to increase her supplies (flour, fish, fruit) for her restaurant

loans.name: Nassan

texts.en:
Nassani is a cattle trader who is married and has three children who are all in school. The drive to get school fees for his children pushed him into the cattle trade 6 years ago. He supplements his income with farming.  

Nassani is constrained by the shortage of land, which limits the output from the cows since they are not well fed. His dream is to acquire a bigger piece of land to graze the animals.  Harsh weather, especially the dry spells, is also affecting the productivity of the animals, limiting his income. Nassani is very hard-working.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cover the costs of irrigation, fertilizer and the harvest.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and lives with her life companion and their five children. Her work is selling cooked food. She has worked in this business for a number of years since it has given her very good results, and at the same time it helped her acquire great experience in preparing them. She is very well known in the village where she sells because as a walking vendor she sells the most delicious food. She already has an extensive clientele because the food that she makes is of the highest quality, with an exquisite flavor and at affordable prices. In addition, her service is very rapid. 

Fatuma is a woman with many goals to achieve. She works day after day to have a prosperous future. Since she has increased her clientele, she wants to increase her production to thus obtain better earnings. She needs to invest in ingredients, but it is a question of capital. For this reason she is applying to Yehu Microfinance for a loan that will permit her to buy corn, corn husks, vegetables, firewood, etc. Fatuma is very responsible and has impeccable morals.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de  65 años de edad  del departamento de Chinandega, casada con dos hijos de  40, 16 años. De los cuales solo el de 16 está bajo su responsabilidad económica ya que es menor de edad y estudia, ella  se desempeña como  secretaria del juzgado de la localidad. Olga está solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejora a su vivienda  que  consisten en cambiara el techo del garaje donde el esposo tiene el taller  de ebanistería y  cambiar el techo de los cuartos, dichas mejoras la ha querido realizar desde hace 1 años pero por falta de recursos económicos no las ha podido hacer. Ya que para su familia es primordial realizar dichas mejoras a su vivienda porque es de donde  obtienen parte de los ingresos del trabajo de su esposo para la mantención de su familia. Olga ya ha realizado créditos con fundación demostrando su responsabilidad con los pagos en tiempo y forma. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: zinc. Perlines, clavos, cemento, alambre. Los  sueños de Olga en un futuro no lejano es llegar a formar a su hijo es un profesional, y realizar por completo las mejoras de su casa para brindarle estabilidad y protección a su familia. La Sra. Olga agradece la ayuda que le brindan a los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos  recurso y países pobre para tener un lugar propio y digno para vivir.
texts.en:
Olga is 65 years old and lives in the Department of Chinandega. She is married and has two children (ages 40 and 16). Only her younger child is under her financial responsibility and is attending school. Olga works as a legal secretary in her town.

She is requesting a loan in order to make a home improvement, which consists of replacing the roof of her garage where her husband has a cabinetmaking workshop. Olga also wants to replace the roof over the rooms. She says that she has wanted to complete these improvements for the past year, but she lacks the financial resources to make this happen. Her family is the main reason why she wants to make these improvements since part of the outcome will help her husband generate income from his work so that they can support themselves.

Olga has already obtained loans from Fundación León 2000 and has demonstrated that she is responsible in submitting her payments on time. With this loan, she will buy construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, nails, cement, and wire. In the near future, she dreams of seeing her child become a professional and completing the improvements to her house so that she can provide stability and protection for her family. Sra. Olga is grateful for the assistance Kiva lenders have provided to people with limited resources in poor countries so that they can have a place of their own and a decent life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials necessary for replacing the roof of her home and her garage.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 55, a resident of Manila. She is married to Constantino, a driver, and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Editha oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote), which seats 14-16 persons and operates at capacity every day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP every day.

Editha is applying for a 24,000 PHP loan from CCT to be used to buy spare parts for and conduct maintenance on the jeepney. Her ambition is to grow her business in the coming years and have a good life with her family.

All CCT community clients, including Editha, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

* Curiously, jeepneys are of American origin. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippine.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for and conduct maintenance on her jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth in bulk and various sewing supplies

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Damas Trabajadoras" lleva mas de 3 años de organización y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes pudieron salir adelante gracias a la ayuda de la fundación y al trabajo de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Myrian es una de las integrantes de éste comité, se unió al comité por la necesidad de tener mas ingresos y así poder solventar los diversos gastos de la casa, ella es vendedora de ropas y cosméticos en forma ambulante. Anhela un futuro mejor para su hijo es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darle la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas y cosméticos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y teniendo productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: The committee"Damas Trabajadoras" has been an organization for more than three years and works with Fundación Paraguaya; the majority of its members have had success thanks to the help of the foundation and the work of every one of the members. Mrs. Myrian is one of the members of this committee and needs to earn more to be able to settle some household expenses. She sells clothes and cosmetics as a street peddler. She wishes for a better future for her son and it is because of this that she works so hard everyday in order to give him the opportunity to study and achieve a better future. She is asking for a loan to purchase garments and cosmetics she will use to continue working and have products to offer her clients.

loans.use: purchase garments and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 25-year-old single gentleman who supports his four siblings. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last three years,  with a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Francis is servicing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in the preparation of his farm and the purchase of inputs.  He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams is to improve his family's living standards and educate his siblings

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 11 children. 

Elizabeth has a fishing business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 7000 to be used in purchasing additional fishing gear and nets.
 
Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: buy fishing gear and nets

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El señor Silverio es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, y cuenta que es comerciante, tiene una Despensa bien surtida en su propia casa, y además de eso también hace  fotocopias. Hace doce años que se dedica a esto y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre compran de él.
Silverio es una persona muy emprendedora que desde siempre ha trabajado y no tiene miedo a los desafíos. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, panificados, verduras, enlatados, cárnicos y demás.
texts.en:
Silverio is from the city of Curuguaty.  He's single and says he's a merchant.  He has a well-stocked store in his own house, and he also makes photocopies.  He has done this work for 12 years and he comments that he has very good customers because most of his neighbors always buy from him.

Silverio is a very enterprising person who has always worked and is not afraid of challenges.  His goal is to be able to continue growing and this way be able to continue helping his family.

He's requesting the loan to buy supplies for his store, such as beverages, baked goods, vegetables, canned goods, meats, and other items.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, vegetables, canned goods, meat, and other supplies

loans.name: Edwige Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est une jeune femme agée de 42 ans, mariée mère de famille. Elle a un petit secrétariat qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.  Sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors elle sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en ajoutant un copieur et le matériel bureautique pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront non seulement d'ajouter le petit matériel bureautique, mais aussi d'aider son époux dans les dépenses quotidiennes et surtout une partie de la scolarisation de leurs enfants
texts.en: Chantal is a young woman, 42 years old, married, and a mother with a family. She has a small business office, which she has been running for two years in a district in the capital. Her customers are becoming more and more numerous, and so she is requesting a loan to expand by adding a copier and office supplies, so as to be able to satisfy her customers and increase her output. The profits earned from this loan will enable her not only to add office supplies and equipment but also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses. In particular, part of the profits will go toward her children's education costs.

loans.use: to purchase a copier and office supplies

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is an entrepreneur who has made progress in her goal thanks to her capacity for work and love for her family, which consists of her six children. She is the owner of a business through which she generates income for the family by selling fried fish.  She began the business 15 years ago. She is asking for a Kiva loan to buy bundles of fish for sale in her business and to get substantial discounts by buying in large volume. Her Kiva loan is the groundwork for the success that has her enthused and dreaming.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl is 34 years old, married and has one child. For the past six years she has owned and operated a sari-sari (general store), earning 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008 Liezyl joined GDMPC. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan that will be used to buy new stock for her store such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soap, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new stock for her store.

loans.name: Ramon Santiago

texts.es:
Ramon, de 59 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de Juguetes, es habitante de Granada conocida por su comercio y lugares turísticos, tiene un hijos de 14 años de edad el cual estudia la secundaria. Inicio como comerciante ambulante, tenía muy pocos juguetes para vender, el dio hacer un carretón que es donde transporte los juguetes que vende ,adicional lo utiliza como exhibidor para mostrar la mercadería que vende, el participa en ferias , festividades de pueblos que es donde busca como mantener en movimiento su inventario, pues tiene la responsabilidad de apoyar a su familia que depende de el. Anteriormente vendía ropa en la ciudad de Managua pero al conocer a su pareja se trasladó a Granada  donde tiene su negocio de vente de juguetes. 
Él está solicitando financiamiento para comprar juguetes al por mayor, pues se acerca los meses de noviembre y diciembre que es donde sus venta aumentan un poco más y necesita tener inventario suficiente para vender . Una de sus metas próximas es comprar otro carretón para vender más juguetes y contratar a otro vendedor
texts.en:
Ramon is 59 years old and earns a living by selling toys. He is a resident of Granada, a city that is known for its trade and its tourist attractions. Ramon has a 14-year-old child who is in high school.

When he started working as a street merchant, Ramon had very few toys to sell. He then built a cart that he uses for transporting the toys that he sells, but he also uses it to display his merchandise. Ramon participates in the fairs and town festivals so that he can maintain a constant level of sales to move his inventory. He has the responsibility of supporting his family who is dependent on him.

Ramon previously sold clothes in the city of Managua, but he then met a couple who moved to Granada and had a business of selling toys. He is now requesting a loan in order to buy toys in bulk. In the approaching months of November and December, his sales should increase a little bit. Therefore, he will need sufficient inventory to sell. Next on his list of goals is to buy an additional cart so that he can hire another salesperson and sell more toys.

loans.use: to buy toys in bulk.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 52, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Saturnino, who is in a buying and selling business. She looks after her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her own business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nenita operates an internet café business. There is growing need for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also serves people who need to rent computers for business purposes like creating  resumes and office documentation, as well as people who just love to surf the net and do social networking.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams to simply be with her family living peacefully. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 61 years old and lives in San Vicente, a part of Sinacaban. She is widowed and has no children. She sells snacks to the local community and earns about 3000 PHP a month.

Remegia has been a member of PMPC for ten months. She is applying for a loan to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc. to make her snacks. She would like to save money in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to use to make her snacks.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is from Alindahaw, Tukuran. She is 39 years old, is married and has four children. To make a living, she has been making and selling food for two years and earns about PHP 2,500 a month for these activities. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Elsie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi, 40, is married, has six children and lives in the town of Msambweni. She has had her own business selling spare parts for five years.

Mishi says that her business has grown, and she needs to stock more spare parts. The challenge is that her store is small. For this reason, she is applying for a 30,000 KES loan from Yehu to rent a bigger store and buy more spare parts to meet her customers’ demands.

Her goal is to continue growing her business so she can improve her family’s and her well being.

loans.use: to rent a bigger store and buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Christine Lorette

texts.fr: Christine est une jeune femme de 27 ans commerçante. Elle a ouvert un petit prêt à porter qu'elle gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 1 ans déjà. Son acceuil chaleureux, sa créativité,ses bons conseils vestimentaires et son expérience lui ont valu une clientèle assez importante. la croissance de sa clientèle lui pose un problème parce qu'elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire tout ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à aller au déballage chaque week end pour acheter en détail et revenir vendre. et ça ne rapporte pas assez d'où l'importance de ce crédit pour elle qui lui pertttra de s'acheter un ballot de vêtements pour sa boutique. ceci lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle, mais aussi de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Elle souhaiterai réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité afin de l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Christine is a young businesswoman, 27 years old, who opened a small ready-to-wear clothing store, which she has been running in a district in the capital for a year already. Her warm welcomes, her creativity, her good fashion advice, and her experience have earned her a rather large customer base. 

The growth in her customer base poses a problem, since she no longer manages to satisfy them all due to low capital funds, which compels her to go to the outlets each weekend to buy retail and then come back to make her sales. This doesn't bring in enough profit, therefore this loan is important, enabling her to purchase a bale of clothing for her store. This will allow her not only to satisfy her customers but also to make more profit. She would like to reinvest her profits in her business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothing to sell

loans.name: Salustiano

texts.es: Salustiano, es de la comarca el Rancho, se dedica  a sembrar maíz, frijol y  trigo además vende cuajadas de la leche que producen sus vaquitas. Don  Salustiano dice que el inicio sus actividades agrícolas fue a la edad de 15 años con dinero que obtenía de trabajo como jornalero, una  parte lo ocupaba para comprar los insumos y otra ahorraba.  Hoy en día  tiene sus tierras propias y sus vacas, en  sus trabajos agrícolas le ayudan dos hijos y la cosecha la vende  en la misma comarca.  Está solicitando  este crédito para para comprar los insumos para la siembra del maíz y frijol  también para limpieza y mejorar la cercas  del potrero. Como proyecto desea  comprar unos terneros  que una vez que se engorden y los venda obtendrá buena ganancia y continuar trabajando en sus siembras.
texts.en:
Salustiano is from the El Rancho region.  He makes a living growing corn, beans, and wheat.  He also sells curd from the milk produced by his cows.

Salustiano says he began working in agriculture when he was 15 years old, with money he earned working as a day laborer.  He used part of the money to buy supplies and saved the rest.  Today he has his own land and cows.  Two sons help him with the farming and he sells the harvest in the same region.

He's requesting this loan to buy the supplies for the corn and bean crops, and to clean and improve the fence around the field.

As a project he wants to continue working on his crops and buy some calves that, once fattened and sold, will give him a good profit.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops and to clean and improve his fence

loans.name: Ñasaindy Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Ñasaindy, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener el grupo, siempre juntas bajo un marco de respeto  mutuo, actualmente se encuentran en el  quinto ciclo.
Norma es miembro del grupo, ella cuenta que vende todo tipo de bebidas, y es gracias a este negocio que ella ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella es muy luchadora y no tiene miedo a hacer ningún tipo de trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser cervezas, gaseosas, vinos, etc, con lo cual podrá seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee has the name of Ñasaindy. They committed to maintain the group always together under a framework of mutual respect. Currently, they are in their fifth cycle.

Norma is a member of the group. She says she sells all kinds of drinks, and thanks to this business she helps her family and gives them everything they need for a decent life without hardship. She is very feisty and is not afraid to do any kind of work.

She is requesting a loan to buy beverages in general, such as beer, soft drinks, wine, etc. with what she will continue offering good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, such as beer, soft drinks, wine, etc.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 38 years old, from Nakuru, and is married to David. They have four children who are between the ages of four and 16 years old.

Teresia has a retail business that she has been running for the past seven years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy sodas and fruits.  She paid her previous loan well and in good time.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sodas and fruits.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer es un grupo de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ellas son 15 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas, que se han unido con el fin de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio de su trabajo en equipo.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Dolores, quien a parte de ser docente, es también peluquera. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada, ya que por medio de sus dos trabajos saca adelante a su familia y también ayuda a las demás miembros de su grupo. Es muy solidaria y con ganas de seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, ruleros, tijeras, shampoo, enjuagues, etc. Dolores y sus compañeras agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
Renacer (Reborn) is a group of 15 women from the city of Paraguarí. They are all friends and neighbors who have joined together with the goal of helping each other through teamwork.

One of these women is Dolores, who besides being a teacher, is also a hairdresser. She is a very self-sacrificing person; through her two jobs, she supports her family and also helps the other members of her group. She is very supportive and is eager to keep growing.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her hair shop, such as dyes, curlers, scissors, shampoos, rinses, etc.Dolores and her friends are grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy dyes, curlers, scissors, shampoos, rinses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Martin Berlin

texts.fr: Martin est une jeune homme de 35 ans marié père de 2 enfants. il est commerçant et a ouvert un prêt à porter qu'il gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans déjà. Son acceuil chaleureux, sa créativité,ses bons conseils vestimentaires et son expérience lui ont valu une clientèle assez importante. la croissance de sa clientèle lui pose un problème parce qu'il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire tout ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à aller au déballage chaque week end pour acheter en détail et revenir vendre. et ça ne rapporte pas assez d'où l'importance de ce crédit pour Samuel qui lui pertttra de s'acheter un ballot de vêtements pour sa boutique. ceci lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle, mais aussi de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Il souhaiterai réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité afin de l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Martin is a young man, 35 years old, married, and the father of two children. He is a merchant and has opened a small ready-to-wear clothing store, which he has been running in a district in the capital for two years already. His warm welcomes, his creativity, his good fashion advice, and his experience have earned him a rather large customer base. 

The growth in his customer base poses a problem, since he no longer manages to satisfy all his customers due to low capital funds, which compels him to go to the outlets each weekend to buy retail and then come back to make his sales. This doesn't bring in enough profit, therefore this loan is important for Martin, enabling him to purchase a bale of clothing for his store. This will allow him not only to satisfy his customers but also to make more profit. He would like to reinvest his profits in his business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothing to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 62, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, a driver, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Adelaida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She runs her business by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Adelaida hopes her business will continue to grow so she will be able to help her family and her grandchildren. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 31 años, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, el es dueño de un Consultorio Odontológico. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora, y nos cuenta que también trabaja en una institución pública.
Luego de terminar la facultad con sacrificio pudo conseguir un trabajo estable, y gracias a su esfuerzo y al ahorro que se formó supo solventar los gastos de inversión del montaje de su consultorio y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela y está saliendo adelante y generando buenos ingresos.
Solicito el crédito para compra de insumos para su consultorio como gomas, bandas, arcos, pastas, etc., con lo cual podrá seguir ofreciendo el buen servicio al que están acostumbrados sus clientes. El agradece por la oportunidad de progreso que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Juan, 31, is married and has two children.  He's the owner of a dental office.  Juan is a very hardworking person.  He says he also works in a public institution.

After finishing his academic program by sacrificing, he managed to get a stable job.  Thanks to his effort and the savings he got together, he was able to cover the expenses of investing in setting up his office.  Today he already has very good customers and he's getting ahead and generating income.

He requested the loan to buy supplies for his office such as rubber, bands, arches, toothpaste, etc.  With these he'll be able to continue giving the good service to which his customers are accustomed.

He's grateful for this opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy rubber, bands, arches, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Clotine

texts.fr: Clotine est un homme de 35 ans, fiancée et mère de 3 enfants , deux vont à l'école. Elle a ouvert une alimentation qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans.Grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et son accueil chaleureux et son rapport avec son voisinage,il a pu acquérir une très grande clientèle. L'augmentation croissante de sa clientèle rend son offre inférieure à la demande d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activité.Grâce à lui il pourra acheter les produits de premiere necessité (deux sacs de riz, 4 cartons de sardine, 4 cartons de tomates et d'huile Mayor)en grande ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Clotine is a 35-year-old woman who is engaged to be married. She is a mother of three children, of whom two are in school. She opened a grocery store, which she has been running for two years. Thanks to her experience in this domain and to her warm welcomes and her rapport with her neighbors, she was able to acquire a very large customer base. 

The growing increase of her customer base has lead to a low supply compared to the demand, therefore her loan for this business is important enabling her to purchase basic goods (2 sacks of rice, 4 boxes of sardines, 4 boxes of tomatoes, and some Mayor oil) in large amounts. This will enable her to satisfy her customers appropriately and to increase her sales, and thus her profit margin. She will reinvest part of the profits in her business. And the rest will allow her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase some basic goods (rice, tomatoes and Mayor oil)

loans.name: Irma Estela

texts.es:
La señora Irma tiene 38 años,  es soltera, tiene una hija, de 22 años,  quien es estudiante y también la ayuda en sus negocios siempre que puede.
La Sra. Irma tiene su negocio de venta de perfumes franceses y joyas de plata desde hace 7 años, cuenta con clientela variada y es ayudada por su hija y su pareja con quien está acompañada hace 5 años, juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante.
Irma solicita este préstamo para la compra de perfumes, joyas de plata, como cadenas, medallas, anillos, pulseras y otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer variedad  a sus clientes y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma is 38 years old, is single, and has a daughter. Her daughter is 22 years old, is a student and also helps her in the business whenever possible. Irma has a business selling French perfumes and silver jewelry. She has had the business for seven years, has varied clientele and gets help from his daughter and her partner, who have been together for five years. Together, they get ahead.

Irma is requesting this loan to buy perfumes and silver jewelry such as chains, medals, rings, bracelets and other items that will allow her to offer variety to her customers and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, as well as silver jewelry.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu lives in Mwambalazi, Mombasa. She works everyday because her dream is to have a store that is well-known in her town. In order to do this, she sells household items to her customers. With this, she has managed to save and invest in another business that has provided her with the opportunity to generate another source of income. 

The lack of working capital is Saumu's biggest challenge, which is why she has turned to Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust for her first loan. With her Kiva loan, she will buy bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and beans, which are in high demand. Her loan should be successful because her sales are based on customer orders. What she buys has a fast turnover, which causes her working capital to regenerate quickly and increase her profits. Having good customers increases the recovery of her capital and thereby her earnings.

loans.use: To buy bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 5º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2010 y gracias a su trabajo están saliendo adelante.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Carlina, quien tiene 2 hijos. Ella está acompañada con el Sr. Ricardo y cuenta que ella se dedica hace varios años a realizar manualidades de todo tipo, con los cuales ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Carlina es una persona con mucha creatividad, y es gracias a esto que puede sentirse útil.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, pinturas y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo sus manualidades y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This members of this group live in the city of Encarnacion.  They started the group in 2010 after being contacted by a representative of the Foundation and this will be their 5th round of Foundation funding.  
Our member, Sra. Carlina, has 2 children.  Her partner is Sr. Ricardo.  She has operated a crafts business for many years and the income she earns from the business helps her husband with the family's expenses.
Sra. Carlina is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--fabric, thread, buttons, paint, etc.--to carry on her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Bajrush

texts.en:
Bajrush is 31 years old and lives in the southwestern part of Kosovo in the Roma Community. A few years ago he began to renovate his house, but he still needs to paint the house and to buy some furniture.

Like many residents of his Roma community, for the last few years he has earned a living by performing music for weddings and other celebrations. Bajrush has a very cheerful and optimistic personality and is a very hard worker. However, the money he generates through his work is not enough for him to finish the renovations needed for his house.

As a result, he is seeking a loan in order to complete the renovations for his house. He would like to thank all the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To complete home renovations by painting his house and purchasing furniture

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina is 41 years old and married to Catherine. Together they have one child.

Maina operates a fish vending business and has been in the business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of approximately 25,000 KES from the business.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a customer. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time. This would be his second loan from KADET and he explains that he will use the loan proceeds to purchase more stocks of fish for sale in his business. In the future, he wants to start distributing fish outside of his town (Nakuru).

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing additional fish

loans.name: Chuluunkhishig

texts.en: Mrs. Chuluunkhishig, 47, works as a tailor in the leather producing factory in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She is a widow and lives with her 2 children in her small apartment. In winter her house becomes so cold due to its age and heat loss. The main heating line is broken and does not work well enough. She uses the coal-fired stove to warm her home, but it usually does not get the home warm enough. For this reason she wants to install a water heat-line to her house. It is less harmful than the coal-fired stove. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to cover the cost of building materials and hired workers to install the new water heating line to her house.

loans.use: To cover the cost of building materials and hired workers to install the new water heating line to her house.

loans.name: Makiye

texts.en:
Makiye is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is employed.

Makiye is a seamstress. She is been in this business since 2006. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.
Shee is requesting $1800 loan to buy two sewing machines. She is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Benjamin Isrrael

texts.es:
BENJAMIN ISRRAEL TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADO TIENE TRES HIJOS, VIVE CON LA ESPOSOA Y CON LOS HIJOS EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RÍOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

BENJAMIN ISRRAEL SE DEDICA A REALIZAR ACTIVIDADES AGRÍCOLAS AL CULTIVO DE CICLO CORTO DE MAÍZ Y FRÉJOL GANDÚL.
SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR CERDOS Y POLVILLO. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS CERDOS Y LA ALIMENTACIÓN PARA CRIARLOS, ENGORDARLOS Y VENDERLOS A UN MEJOR PRECIO.

lAS CONPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS ANIMALES LO HARÁN EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS.  EL SUEÑO EN LOS PROXIMOS AÑOS QUISIERA REUNIR DINERO PARA PODER ARREGLAR LA CASA Y LUEGO PONERCE UN NEGOCIO.
LOS DESAFIOS  ES PODER CRIAR A LOS CERDOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA AYUDAR A LOS HIJOS EN LOS DEBERES.
texts.en:
Benjamin Israel is 43 years old.  He is married, has three children, and lives with his wife and children in the City of Ventanas, within the Rios province.

He is a member of the NORTE community group, located in northern Ventanilla, where people are farmers or raise livestock.  Benjamin Israel is a farmer and raises short cycle crops, such as corn and pigeon pea beans.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy pigs and feed.  This loan will help him to buy pigs and feed so that he can raise them, fatten them up, and sell them at a better price.

He buys and sells his animals in the city of Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to save up some money and fix up his home and then set up a business in the next few years.

His challenges are to be able to raise the hogs.  He likes to help his children with their chores in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Kuña Rory gracias a su trabajo en conjunto y la ayuda que se dan las unas a las otras ya están en el ciclo numero 11.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Basilia quien tiene 3 hijos, y cuenta que está casada con el Sr. Epifanio. Ella se dedica hace varios años a realizar manualidades. Cuenta la Sra. Basilia que todos en su familia se ayudan para salir adelante, en especial ella y su marido luchan por sus hijos, para poder darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener antes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, pinturas, hilos, pinceles y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las manualidades que vende.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory community bank is embarking on its 11th round of funding.  
Our member, Sra. Basilia, and her husband, Sr. Epifanio, have 3 children.  She has operated a crafts business for many years.  She tells us that everyone in her family is working to get ahead.  She and her husband work especially hard because they want to be able to give their children everything that they were unable to buy for themselves before.
Sra. Basilia is applying for a loan that she use to buy the supplies she needs--fabric, paint, thread, brushes, etc.--to operate her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.fr: Ernestine est une jeune femme de 29 ans, après sa formation, elle a un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 2 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des pagnes et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Ernestine is a young 29-year-old woman who opened a sewing shop after completing her training. The business has been running smoothly for the past two years. She also does embroidery, but she is lacking the supplies needed to fill orders quickly and meet customer demand in a timely manner. 

She is seeking a loan to buy pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and small sewing supplies (pins, needles, lining, thread, etc.), which would help to cut down on her trips to the market. She would spend more time sewing and selling. 

The profits earned through this loan will allow her not only to buy the supplies that she needs to expand her activity, but also to support some of her own needs and  provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and small sewing supplies (pins, needles, lining, thread, etc.).

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 62-year-old, married woman. She and her husband, Bernard, have eight children.

For the past 40 years, Susan has operated a clothing sales business in the town of Naivasha. She also rents houses and works as a farmer to generate additional income.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers. She successfully repaid her previous loan on time. This would be her second loan, and she plans on using the loan proceeds to buy a variety of clothes to re-sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to increase the number of her rental houses so that she is better able to meet all of her family's living expenses and needs.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes.

loans.name: Marlyse Isabelle

texts.fr: Isabelle est une femme âgée de 33 ans, mère de mère de famille ..Elle est commerçante et a ouvert vend les beignets, haricot et frites de poisson dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 10ans.son savoir faire,la qualité de ses produits, ses bonnes relations avec son voisinnage et les prix pratiqués lui ont valu une grande clientèle qu'elle a du mal à satisfaire à cause de la rupture permanente des stocks de marchandises.Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter ses stocks de marchandises(Achat du petit Un sac de haricot, 4 sacs de farine, 1 sac de mais et 3 bidons d'huiles) afin de satisfaire sa clientèle abondande et exigente.Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'étendre son activité dans un premier temps et subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille en second lieu.
texts.en:
Isabelle is 33 years old and married with children. She is a merchant who runs a food stall where she has been selling beignets, beans and fried fish in a district of the capital for the past 10 years. Her experience, the quality of her products, her good relationship with the locals and her prices have helped her to build a large customer base whose needs she can hardly meet due to a stock shortage. 

She is seeking a loan to replenish her stock of supplies. She will buy one bag of beans, four bags of flour, one bag of maize, and three jugs of oil. This will help her to meet the needs of her customers, who are numerous and demanding. 

The profits earned will allow her to expand her activity and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy one bag of beans, four bags of flour, one bag of maize, and three jugs of oil.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
This is Rodolfo, 46, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. He manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rodolfo operates a party needs (balloon) business.  There will always be children’s parties and other events that will need balloon decorating and party accessories. That’s why this kind of business is in demand in the Philippines. He also has a side car for additional income.  He earns a minimum of 3500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales weekly.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of materials and other supplies needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Rodolfo hopes to expand his business in the coming years and dreams to have his own house and lot. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials and supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth tiene 33 años, está casada con el Sr. Elvis hace 18 años,  del matrimonio nacieron cuatro hijas, por quienes ella y su marido se esfuerzan al máximo para darle todo lo que necesitan y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
La Sra. Elizabeth  es comerciante hace doce años, tiene una linda despensa y carnicería con todas las comodidades en un lugar bastante poblado de la ciudad. Comenta que comenzó con un pequeño almacén en una Quinta, y  luego  con mucho sacrificio iba creciendo poco a poco con la ayuda de su marido que se encargaba de la carnicería y la provisión productos, se levantan bien temprano para ir al Mercado Municipal para  las compras de los productos agrícolas, bien frescas y así ofrecer lo mejor a su clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de Carne, bebidas gaseosas, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio, ya que son los productos que más se venden.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth, 33, and her husband, Sr. Elvis, have been married for 18 years.  They have four children and work hard to raise and support them.
Sra. Elizabeth has operated a grocery and meat sales business for twelve years.  Her store is in well-trafficked part of town.  She says that she started with a corner shop in a "quinta" [normally a country house, but probably something else in this context] and built it over many years.  Her husband helped her start the business.  She gets up early to buy the best products from the Mercado Municipal because she wants her customers to have the best.
Sra. Elizabeth is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with meat, soft drinks and other merchandise that she will then resell.

loans.use: to stock her grocery and meat sales business.

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en: Elinita is a 42-year old resident of Alindahaw, Tukuran. She provides for her child's needs from the little amount of 5,000 she gains monthly from her own piggery business.  She has had the business for 2 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband.  Since 2010 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan at GDMPC Micro Finance of PHP10,000 to buy feeding supplies. Elinita wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 30 years, married, and has one child. Four other family members live with him, two of whom are employed.

Amir owns a car repairing shop. He specializes in repairing American cars. He established his business in 2007 and he now has two employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2100 a Youth loan to buy a machine specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his work

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 46-year-old, single man residing in Sto. Niño in Tukuran.

Edwin operates a farming business. Specifically, to earn a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale in his local community. He explains that he has been in this business for five years and that he he earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from the business.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. Recently, Edwin joined GDMPC. In the future, Edwin wants to be able to save money as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to expand his rice farming business by purchasing fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 41 year-old.  She is married to Isaac and together they have four children.  She operates a grocery story and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  She will use the loan amount to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to see her children finish their education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Con la confianza de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo, 22 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se han unido y trabajan juntas y de esa forma ayudan a sus familias.
Jazmin, miembro del grupo se dedica a la venta de zapatillas bordadas. Comenta que tiene mucha venta, ya que las mismas son muy solicitadas por sus clientas, además que siempre tiene muy buen trabajo. Ella es una persona muy creativa y lo muestra en cada zapatilla que hace.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas, hilos, lentejuelas, pinzas y demás insumos para seguir vendiendo sus zapatillas bordadas. Jazmin, como las demás miembros agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
With the confidence to help their families through their work, 22 women in from Caaguazú have united to work together, and in this way, help their families.

Jazmin, a member of the group, sells embroidered slippers. She says that she has a lot of sales since they are in high demand and always of good quality. She is a very creative person, which shows in each slipper that she makes. 

She is requesting a loan to buy slippers, thread, sequins, tweezers and other supplies to keep selling the embroidered slippers. Jazmin, like the other members, is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy slippers, thread, sequins, tweezers and other supplies.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, gracias a su esfuerzo ya está en el ciclo numero 11. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento para ellas y sus familias y es por ello que decidieron formar parte del grupo.
Zonia, una de las miembros de este grupo vende ropas. Cuenta que cuando empezó le fue muy difícil, pero que con el correr del tiempo fue ganando confianza y hoy en día ya es una buenísima vendedora. Gracias a su trabajo Zonia ayuda a su familia y también aporta con los gastos que día a día surge, ella es muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Ella solicita el crédito para que por medio de este pueda surtir sus prendas y pueda dar mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Renacer women's committee is embarking on its 11th round of funding.  The women, all heads of their respective households, started the community bank because they saw it as the best means to provide for themselves and their families.  
Our member, Zonia, operates a clothing sales business.  She tells us that she struggled at first but is much more confident now and considers herself to be a good saleswoman.  Thanks to the business, Zonia can provide for her family and even keep up with ever-rising prices.  She is an enterprising woman with a strong drive to get ahead.
Zonia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her clothing sales business with the merchandise that her customers most want.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 39-year-old, married man. He and his wife, Lucy, have two school-going children.

For the last eight years, he has worked in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru town.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of its field officers. This would be his third loan through KADET, and he explains that he successfully repaid his previous loan on time. He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES, and he plans to use the loan proceeds to buy two bulls and four sheep, which he will care for and sell for profits. In the future, he hopes to save money and to purchase a lorry to aid him for transportation purposes.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing two bulls and four sheep

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
This is Procesa, 62, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a vendor. She and her husband manage their household and raise their children while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Procesa has a lace making business. She mainly makes laces for curtains, tables and others. She also does repairs and alterations. She also sells native products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Procesa hopes her business grows and dreams to have her house renovated through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for threads, cloths and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosilia

texts.en: Because of her need to generate an income so that she could improve her family’s well-being, Rosilia began her retail shop business. Rosilia is a married woman who lives with her husband and three children. Her main clients are the neighboring community members.  Rosilia is requesting her first loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for one year and that made it possible for her to set up her business, in order to give it a more comfortable environment. She will use the money from her first Kiva loan to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale in order to increase her opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers that have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention she wants to capture.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale

loans.name: Vimie

texts.en: Vimie, single, is 36 years old and lives in D-Fernan, Bonifacio. Vimie operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 12 years and every month he earns PHP 5,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Vimie joined GDMPC. Vimie hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Burenbuyan

texts.en: Mrs. Burenbuyan is 34 years old, and is one of the hardworking women. Since 2007 she has been working as a salesperson in a trading company. She lives with her husband and her daughter, 3, in a ger (a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent) in the ger district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This time she is requesting a loan to repair her old and bad house. Her family owns a house behind their ger and it was built many years ago. Currently her family does not use it due to the cold, chilly inside temperature in winter time. The house suffers heat loss trough its thin and bad walls. She wants to add wall insulation to her house which is currently not insulated. As she said she will complete the work with her husband within this autumn if they can make it in time.

loans.use: To repair her old and bad house.

loans.name: Fredy German

texts.es:
FREDY GERMAN TIENE 39 AÑOS DE EDAD DE ESTADO CIVIL UNIÓN LIBRE TIENE CUATRO HIJOS, VIVE CON LA ESPOSA Y CON LOS HIJOS EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RÍOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS

FREDY GERMAN SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE CERDOS. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR CERDOS Y POLVILLO. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS CERDOS PARA ENGORDARLOS Y VENDERLOS AÚN BUEN PRECIO.

EL SUEÑO ES HACER UNOS PEQUEÑOS ARREGLOS A LA CASA. LOS DESAFÍOS A LOS QUE SE ENFRENTA SON LAS ENFERMEDADES QUE LES DAN A LOS CERDOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA CUIDAR A LOS ANIMALES.
texts.en:
Fredy German is 39 years old.  He has four children and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, within the Los Rios province. 
 
He is a member of the Norte community organization, located in the north Ventanilla area, part of the Ventanas settlement, where the people are farmers and raise livestock.
 
Fredy German buys and sells pigs.  He is asking for this loan to buy pigs and feed.  This loan will help him buy the pigs so that he can fatten them up and sell them for a good price.
 
His dream is to make a few small repairs to his home.  The challenges he faces are the diseases that the pigs get.  He likes to care for his animals in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Dionisa

texts.en:
Dionisia is a 56-year-old married woman and mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Dionisia works really hard to earn a living so that she can support her family especially in meeting their needs.

She has engaged in a hog raising business and fish vending for more than 20 years now. These are the sources of her income.

As of now, Dionisia is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed for the pigs and to buy fish to sell.  Through this loan, Dionisia will be able to augment her income and continually support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Esperanza De Mujer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Esperanza de Mujer” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de joyas, venta de perfumes, taller de costura, venta de sushi y arrollados primavera, comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ivonne, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste polera negra de color negra y con adornos de flores de color gris en el pecho, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, botas, carteras y blue jeans, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, su mercadería la vende en colegios, municipalidades, pero generalmente en su casa.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en fábricas donde encuentra loa zapato y los demás accesorios los compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente blue jeans para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Ivonne es tener un local para tener su mercadería ordenada y atender a su clientela de manera más tranquila.
Ivonne vive junto a su esposo, madre y dos hijos de 21 y 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su local, y a nivel familiar es darle un buen pasar a su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Esperanza de Mujer” and is made up of 21 enterprising women who work in different areas.  Among them are clothing sales, jewelry sales, perfume sales, sewing, sushi and spring rolls, fast food, and services among other things.  All of the members live in the city of Curicó.

Ivonne is a member of the communal bank and is sitting in the first row in the photograph, second from the left.  She’s wearing a black top with grey flowers on it.  Her hair is dark and she wears it loosely.

For the past year she has been selling shoes, purses, wallets, and jeans.  She says that she works from her home from Monday through Saturday and makes her schedule according to her availability.  She sells her merchandise in schools and in town, but mostly from her home. 

She buys her merchandise from factories in Santiago, where she can get shoes and other accessories at low cost, and therefore economically.

She will use the money from this loan to buy jeans to stock her business.

One of Ivonne’s goals is to set up a shop where she can have her merchandise organized and be able to serve her customers in a more relaxed way.

Ivonne lives with her husband, mother, and two children, ages 21 and 9.  Her dream is to have her own shop, and be able to provide for her family.

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity giver her through Fondo Ezperanza, because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that there is good communication among the members of her communal bank.  Along with that, the training has helped her learn sales and accounting strategies.

Curicó is located in the Maule region, in the country’s central zone.  It has a Mediterranean type climate and it’s considered one of the nicest in the county.  It’s also known for its vineyards and its natural beauty.  Even though the work opportunities have increased, the region continues to be one of the poorest in the nation, according to the census.

loans.use: to buy jeans for resale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan leaves in Mwambalazi, Kenya.  He is a good entrepreneur, and for seven years he has owned his own business. He operates a livestock selling business, selling to butcher operators, neighbours, and passersby. 

Today his dreams continue to grow and his goals are to continue increasing his income so that he can expand to a butcher shop and to be very successful.

His market is growing and so is the amount of capital that he needs to continue providing the products his customers demand. This will be his second loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy cows and goats.  He will promote his business with special discounts. He wants to offer great prices to his customers so that he can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why he will be successful in investing his Credit Kiva loan in his business.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a thirty-year-old married mother of five who describes herself as a very responsible person. She opened up her little neighborhood kiosk five years ago and it has since been doing very well. Josephine has decided to take out her first loan with which she hopes to increase the variety of products she offers in her kiosk. Josephine wants to add stock of basic commodities like flour, snacks, soft drinks, etc, to her kiosk. She is very excited about this next step and hopes that the larger supply of products will attract a wider variety of clients. Her dream is to continue to expand her business in order to stabilize her family's income level.

loans.use: to add stock of basic commodities like flour, snacks, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: C18011 Abarwanashyaka Group

texts.en:
Egidie is 32 years old and married, with two children, aged 5 and 10 years old. 

She owns an agriculture business, selling rice, which is open from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day. She is the leader of the group, which is called "C18011 Abarwanashyaka" in the local language. (She is the first person on the left side.) She has three years of experience in this work and employees two people to help her.

Egidie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. With the profit, she expects to save money for her future and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
l comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está conformado de 22 integrantes todas señoras humildes, trabajadoras, y excelentes  personas.
Patricia, miembro de este grupo, comenta que le han ayudado mucho, ya que no solo creció en su negocio, sino también como persona, ya que la interacción con las demás personas es algo muy valioso. Patricia vende prendas, y solicita el crédito para comprar ropas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder tener buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee of Enterprising Women of the City of Caaguazú is made up of 22 members; all are ladies who are humble, hardworking and excellent people.

Patricia is a member of this group and says that she has been helped a lot since not only did her business grow but she did as well since interacting with other people is something very valuable. Patricia sells clothing and needs a loan to buy summer clothes since the season is approaching and she would like to have variety of items to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chiphenyo

texts.en:
Chiphenyo is a married woman. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food for the family. 
For the past 2 years, Chiphenyo has operated a cereals business. Chiphenyo has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and bundles of fish, cooking oil. Chiphenyo sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities from Mombasa town to her cereals business. Chiphenyo hopes to see her business expand to a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and bundles of fish, cooking oil.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children, two of who are employed.
Mohamad owns a shop for mobile phones and their accessories. After working in this business for five years Mohamad opened his own store in 2011. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
He is requesting $3000 to get signage for the shop and to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to get signage for the shop and pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Bazee

texts.en:
Bazee is 26, married, and has three bouncing children. He is married to Asha who helps him run a coconut selling business. Bazee has been in this business for five years, selling his products at the market.
