Los Parra is the name of a small group made up of four people: Efigenia, who rents a cargo vehicle, José Antonio, who is a taxi driver, and Teresa and Jesús, who buy and sell fertilizers.  This group is located in the community of Palma Cuata, which is known for being a small community surrounded by sugar cane fields and whose people are very cheerful and friendly and work in the fields.

José Antonio, or Toño as he is called in the community, is 41 years old and he is married to Griselda.  He tells us that he does not have much schooling and that his family has always been in the business of driving taxis.  He drove one of his father's taxis for several years and saved up, as his goal was to buy his own taxi so that his earnings would be free and so he could be independent.  After a little over ten years of work he was able to get his own taxi.  He works every day from eight in the morning until eight in the evening and he does not take days off, as holidays and weekends are when he has the most work.  He tells us that over the years he has acquired many customers and he even goes to their front doors when they call him.  He says that his work is nice because he knows all the people in his town and he has made good friends in addition to offering a service and earning money.  He will invest this loan in some parts and tires to maintain his taxi and thereby offer his customers better service.  He hopes that with this loan his business will prosper and his earnings will increase so that he can offer his wife a better quality of life and, in the future, he hopes to be able to invest in another taxi.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi by buying parts and tires.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Lona Seluwa

texts.en:
lona  is 34 years old and a businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4  and 10.  All of them go to school.

lona runs a general store, and she has been in business for five years. She has no employees. 

She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of  SDG 2,000 to purchase cowpeas, beans, onions, and many others.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years lona would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

lona says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more items like onions, cowpeas, and beans.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of five school-aged children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is a fish vendor since her husband works as a fisherman. 

Leonila is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the pump boat.

In the future, Leonila wants to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school for their learning and bright future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the pump boat.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 47 years old and is married with 10 children who are all in school. They live in Nakuru town.

Rahab is a farmer and has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to be used in her farm to improve the harvest.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman with 4 children. Jocelyn is 39 years old, residing at Garang, Tangub City. Jocelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.  Jocelyn joined GDMPC in 2009. In the future, Jocelyn wants to build a house and to support her children in finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or convenience store. She sells various types of goods to the people in the community. She also provides sound-system services for special occasions.

Felicidad dreams of expanding her business but lacks the resources to do so. So, she joined CEVI to gain access to financial services offered by the organization to microentrepreneurs like her. She is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP to buy more stocks to sell in her store, such as canned goods, shampoo, cooking ingredients, soda and other items.

In the future, Felicidad wants to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store, including canned goods, shampoo, cooking ingredients and soda

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married, and has two children. Three other family members live with him, two of whom are employed.

Haytham owns a small grocery store and sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009 and has acquired good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2400 youth loan to buy an air conditioner and a generator. He also wants to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and a generator for his grocery store, and help him to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es: Nora del Carmen de  59 anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de 31, 29 anos de edad del departamento de León, lugar ubicado en el occidente del país, León se caracteriza por ser una zona turista y orgullosamente tenemos la catedral de león como patrimonio de la humanidad. Nora el Carme tiene una pulpería como actividad económica desde hace  5 anos ubicada en su casa de habitación. La rutina de Nora es abrir sus puertas al publico todos los día desde las 6: am hasta las 9: pm para ofrecer sus productos a su clientela. El financiamiento lo  necesita para surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diario del hogar como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, leche, pan, huevos, verduras, entre otros. Nora del Carmen agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Nora del Carmen is 59 years old and is a single mother with two children who are 31 and 29 years old. She is from the department of León, located in the west of the country. León is known for being a tourist area and it proudly has the Cathedral of León, which is World Heritage. 

Nora del Carmen's economic activity is a store she has had for five years, located in her home. Nora's routine is to open doors to the public every day from 6am to 9pm to offer products to her clientele.

She needs the financing to stock her store with products of daily consumption such as rice, beans, sugar, candy, milk, bread, eggs, and vegetables, among others. Nora del Carmen is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to business people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her store with daily products such as rice, beans, sugar, candy, milk, bread, eggs, and vegetables.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 55 years old and married, with four children. He is a market vendor and sells different kind of food products, such as beverages, rice, butter and bread as well as detergents. He has 20 years of experience in this field. His son helps him to sell products.  

Hasan is on pension, but his pension is too small.  Hence, trading is his main source of financial income. 

He applied for a loan of AZN 1,800 to increase the number of his products and increase his sales. This will be his fifth loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy and diversity his food products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has five children, only one of whom goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She's had a business selling charcoal for 10 years. She sells her charcoal at wholesale to all people.  She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO so she can buy more bags of charcoal.  

Margaret earns additional income by selling piped water.  Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves.  She is hoping to buy a delivery van, and also to build rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise has been running a timber yard for the past four years, during which time business has improved.  She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD so she can buy more timber, sand paper, cement and ballast to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to own a full-fledged timber and hardware store in Naivasha in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more timber, sand paper, cement and ballast to add to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es: Norma Lucia de 27 anos de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de 2 anos Es originaria del municipio de Malpaisillo, y esta ubicado en la parte norte del Departamento de León. Norma  Lucia tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación y cuenta con una experiencia de 1 ano. Anteriormente ella tenia su negocio era venta de mercadería como ropa, cosméticos, zapatos. La actividad cambio porque tiene un pequeño hijo y no tiene quien se lo cuide  decidió tener un negocio en su misma vivienda. Norma Lucia ya ha trabajado con otros créditos y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir y surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diario del hogar como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, dulces, huevos, leche de bolsa, gaseosas, jugos, fósforos. Una pulpería es una tienda que vende productos  de al por menor o en cantidades pequeña. Norma Lucia agradece la ayuda que los inversionista kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Norma Lucia is 27 years old and a single mom of a 2 year old son. She is from the city of Malpaisillo which is located in the northern part of the León Department. She has been working in a grocery located in her home for a year now.  Before this business she used to sell merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics, and shoes. She changed jobs and decided to work from home since she did not have anyone to look after her son. Norma Lucia has requested previous loans and has demonstrated responsibility by paying them back in a timely manner. She will use the loan to stock up her grocery store with groceries such as: sugar, rice, bean, oil, candy, eggs, milk, carbonated drinks, juices, and matches. A grocery store sells products at retail prices in small amounts. Norma Lucia is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders have offered to people with scarce resources in third world countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: stock up her grocery store with groceries such as: sugar, rice, bean, oil, candy, eggs, milk, carbonated drinks, juices, and matches.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 50 years old. He lives in Khoni District, West Georgia, with her 20-year-old daughter, Teona. 

Eliza requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. Eliza’s husband and a son live abroad. They work abroad and send part of their income to the family. 

Eliza is leading her family's small-scale agricultural business. She runs a family-owned dairy farm with two milk cows. Eliza produces cheese and sells it in the village. The family's average monthly income is GEL 150. It is not enough to provide Eliza and her daughter with normal living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Eliza requested a loan from Credo to start her family business. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for a business start-up and re-start-up with fewer conditions to the country's rural poor. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of low incomes, and they often do not have access to credit. 

With the credit, Eliza will purchase chickens to start a poultry farm. She will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard, raise them, and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Eliza and her daughter also hope that the income will be enough for the family, so that their family members will be able to return home and work in the family business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for a poultry farm start-up.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 27 years old and has three children between the ages of four years and three months old. Charles has a cereals business that he has been doing for the past 10 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to buy sacks of maize and beans to add to his inventory for sale. He hopes to venture into the transportation business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy sacks of maize and beans

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en:
Ma. Helen is a married woman and mother of an eight-year-old boy, from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Helen is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat for her husband. With this, his husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus augmenting their sales and profit.

Ma. Helen wants to improve their business and support the schooling of their son.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for their boat.

loans.name: Kojiya

texts.en:
Kojiya is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba.  She is married and has three children between the ages of 6  and 13.  All of them go to school.

Kojiya  runs a general store, and she has been in business for five years.  She has no employees.  She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.  She is taking a loan of SDG 4,000 to purchase sugar, soda, soap, and many others.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Kojiya would like to expand her business.  Her  major challenges include high prices in the market.

Kojiya says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like soda, tea leaves, and sugar.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old, and he resides in Msambweni with his spouse and four children. In order to provide for the family he started a green grocery five years ago, selling from a small stall. Due to his kindness and caring nature, and the good services he offers, he has established a good customer base. 

David sells a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables. He is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kales, onions, etc. This will enable him to continue meeting his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kale, onions, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is an enterprising woman. She is 40 years old and lives with her partner Bilali in the town of Msambweni. They both work in the retail trade. 

Masika has a well-stocked store in her home. In it she sells coconuts at retail. She is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve her quality of life. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to educate her children.

She will use this loan to pay school fees for her first born who recently joined the university. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her first born who recently entered the university.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 38 years old, lives in Nyandarua South, and is married with three children between the ages of 10 and three.

Isaac has a crop farming business which he has been operating for the past six years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD so he can buy a dairy cow to raise for milk production. 

He hopes to venture into the cereals business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to raise for milk production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest and reliable.

He operates a carpentry workshop where he sells couches, tables, chairs, etc.  His business is located within a busy slum and his primary customers are residents from the slum. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve his business. He plans to use the KES 20,000 loan to buy loose tools for his carpentry workshop. His business goal is to run multiple workshops within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business to meet his family's financial needs.

loans.use: to buy loose tools for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La Señora Eva es cliente de la institución lleva ya dos ciclos nos cometa que le gusto mucho trabajar con la institución es por eso que nuevamente solicito un nuevo crédito, Doña Eva vive en un municipio pequeño llamado Ixtlahuaca  que significa "tierra despoblada", es un lugar muy agradable que tiene una gran plaza los lunes donde los comerciantes venden, ropa, verduras, frutas, zapatos etc. Doña Eva tiene 32 años de edad está casada desde hace 6 años con el señor Juan Carlos juntos han procreado  4 niños, tres aun no asisten a la escuela. Doña Eva tiene 4 estéticas que atiende en el mismo municipio de ixtlahuaca, ella inicio el negocio porque estudio estilismo y después empezó a trabajar, le gustaba mucho atender a sus clientas y así fue como decidió iniciar con una estética propia después poco a poco puso las demás estéticas, en la estética donde ella misma atiende y donde se realizo la entrevista tiene 7 años de experiencia en su actividad nos platica que el crédito anterior le sirvió de mucho ya que pudo comprar el suficiente material para trabajar por un buen tiempo sin preocupaciones por la falta de material, esta vez está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar nuevos tratamientos que están lanzando, también quiere comprar herramientas como planchas de pelo, secadoras, y quizás pueda comprar nuevos muebles. En su actividad no presenta ninguna dificultad por el cual tenga que preocuparse le va muy bien sin embrago la señora Eva comento "Me gustaría mucho tener más producto para tener más clientes los productos muchas veces son muy costosos, teniendo más productos y si mis clientes llegan a pedirme un tratamiento yo lo puedo realizar sin ninguna dificultad porque tengo el material disponible y con mis ganancias puedo mejorar la calidad de vida de mis niños y asegurar su bienestar educativo".
texts.en:
Eva is customer of the institution, she has been already two cycles.  She tells us that she enjoyed very much working with the institution and that is why once again she requested a new loan. Eva lives in a small municipality called Ixtlahuaca, which means "uninhabited land". This is a very nice area with a large plaza where vendors sell clothing, vegetables, fruit, shoes, etc. on Mondays. 

Eva is 32 and has been married to Juan Carlos for six years. They have four children, three of whom have not yet started school. Eva has four salons in Ixtlahuaca. She started her business because she studied styling and then started working. She greatly enjoyed tending to her clients, and so she decided to open her own salon. Afterwards, bit by bit, she opened the other salons. The salon which she herself tends to, and where we did the interview, has been open for seven years. During the interview, she told us that the last loan helped her a lot because she was able to buy the supplies to work for awhile without worrying a shortage of supplies. 

This time, she is requesting a loan to buy new of dyes and treatments that she is launching. She also wants to buy flat irons and hear dryers and perhaps new furniture.  

In her business, she does not see any difficulty by which she has to worry about. She is doing very well. Nevertheless, Eva commented 'I would be very happy to have more products to have more clients, the products many times are very costly.  If my clients come to me for treatment, having more products allow me to perform without any difficulty because I have the material available. With my profits, I can improve the quality of life for my children and ensure their educational welfare'.

loans.use: to buy dyes, treatments, shampoo, pins, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a type of roof that provides shade.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 29 years old and from Naivasha.   He has two children, who are aged 10 years and five years old.

Evans has a pool table business that he has been running for the past year.  He has applied for his second loan to enable him buy another pool table to add to what he already has.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy another pool table.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 29 years old. He is married to Martha and together they have two children, ages four and two years old. He operates a motorcycle and has been in the business for the past four years from Nakuru office. This is his first business loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers. He will use this loan to purchase another motorcycle to enable him to add to his income. He hopes to eradicate poverty in his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las flores le pusieron este nombre ya que las integrantes son puras señoras. Viven en una localidad llamada Tuñajen, en donde se cosecha la pimienta y celebran la fiesta de san Felipe en el mes de febrero.
 
  La señora Francisca es quien se le tomo  la entrevista, en la que lleva integrada en el grupo ocho ciclos y está muy contenta  ya que le va bien, es casad con el señor  Maurilio en la que lleva casada veinte años  y a su responsabilidad tiene cuatro hijos  que están en secundaria y primaria.

   Trabaja el préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas  para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños, en donde lleva  trabajando siete años y le va bien  ya que con ello ha tenido como comprar más mercancía y poder  apoyarse con las ganancias  para el sostenimiento de su pequeña familia.
 
   Se dedica a esta actividad para poder independizarse y tener de donde aporta, a un así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el campo sembrando maíz y frijol  y luego venderlo  para que así tenga mejores ingresos.
 
  Lo que más desea es que sus hijos le echen ganas y pueda seguir adelante con su estudios,  para más adelante puedan independizarse.
 
   Quienes integran el grupo son: Migdalia quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de cerdo para engordarlo y luego venderlo por kilo, la señora Felicita invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos agrícolas como son: el café, guineo entre otras furas, la señora Felisa invertirá en la compra y  inventa de ropas, la señora Margarita invierte el préstamo en la compra de alimentos para la engorada de marranos para luego venderlo por kilo y la señora Jessica también invertirá en la compra de ropas.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Flores [The Flowers]. They chose this name because the members are all ladies. They live in a town called Tuñajen, where peppers are grown. They also celebrate the feast of San Felipe in February.

Francisca is who took the interview, she has been in this group for eight cycles already. She is very happy and is doing well. She is married with Maurilio, they have been married for 20 years and she has four children under her responsibility, who are in secondary and primary school.

She works buying and selling clothes for women and men, girls and boys. She has been working on this for seven years and she is doing well. With the loan, she will be able to buy more merchandise. With the profits she will support and sustain her small family. She is dedicated to this activity in order to be independent and contribute, although she also has the support of her husband, who works planting corn and beans to later sell it and have better income. What she desires the most is that her children try their best to keep forward with their studies, so later they can become independent. 

Those who form the group are the following. Migdalia will invest the loan in the purchase and the sale of pigs, fatting them and then selling them per kilo. Felicita will invest the loan in the purchase of agricultural products such as coffee, and bananas among other fruits. Felisa will invest in the purchase and the sale of clothes. Margarita will invest the loan in the purchase of food to fatten pigs to later sell them per kilo. Jessica will also invest in the purchase of clothes.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of clothes.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano is a fisherman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has three children. He has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income, which he uses for the needs of the family and schooling of his children. 

Marciano is asking for a loan worth 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. Through this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Marciano wants to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Saul

texts.en: Saul is a 51-year-old man from Naivasha. He is married with three children who are between 15 and 22 years old. Saul has a tailoring business that he has been doing for the past two years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy materials to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do well after this loan and he will be able to meet the demands of his clients. He hopes to be able to improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from a small village of Khashuri district. She is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two grown sons. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they run an animal husbandry business of four pigs, a calf and three milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Mariam produces cheese and sells it at the local market.  

In addition to those activities, they grow different kinds of vegetables on family-owned land and produce hay as well. Part of the harvested production is sold at the local open market, and the rest is used for family needs. Mariam works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family.

She requested a loan to expand a shed and purchase pigs. Mariam will purchase construction materials for a new shed. The existing one is already too small and doesn’t allow Mariam to plan future expansion of the family’s farming activities. After the pigs are raised and fattened, the family will sell meat and piglets, and this will increase the family income. With the increased income, Mariam will be able to purchase household things and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to expand a shed and purchase pigs.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 47, has been married to Fatuma for a long time; they live in their own house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Mohamed operates a fishing business. Thanks to this work, he has been able to get ahead, educate his children, maintain their home and overcome unexpected expenses. Mohamed has asked for this loan to buy fishing net.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Tereka Lasuba

texts.en:
Tereka is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 6 and 13. All of them are in school.

Tereka runs a general store and has been in business for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 4000 SDG to purchase maize, cassava, etc. She has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Tereka would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Tereka says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more maize, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Laureine

texts.en:
"I am Laureine from Saida. I live in the Ain Al Helwi, Palestinian refugee camp. I would like to take out a loan to expand my business of selling clothes. These are some of the items I sell: pants, sweaters, shirts, shorts."

Laureine is a 23-year-old married woman from the Ain Al Helwi camp in Saida. For the past three years, she has operated a clothing retail business in her neighborhood. She is well known in her community and new customers typically come and seek her out. Laureine has one son.

Laureine has requested a youth loan to purchase clothes, perfumes and other accessories for resale. She used to import these goods cheaply from Syria but the fighting there has caused her to import from Beirut instead. Prices are now more expensive than they used to be. This loan allows her to purchase winter clothes and school clothes for the coming season. She will pay this loan back over the coming year.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and accessories for resale

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from the small village of Sachkhere district. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters, a son, a daughter-in-law, a mother-in-law and a granddaughter. The elder daughter works as a teacher at the local school and gets a monthly salary. Manana’s husband and son are tractor drivers and serve local farmers to get a service fee for the work. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm of two calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Manana produces cheese, which she sells at the local market. In addition, they grow haricots and maize on family-owned land. Part of the harvested produce is sold at the local open market, and the rest is used for the family's needs. Manana works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income to save and use to improve their living conditions.

Manana has applied for this loan to increase the number of cows and renovate her house. With the requested loan she plans to purchase an additional milk cow. This will allow her to produce more milk from her dairy and increase her sales, which provide her main income. The rest of the money will be used for house renovation. Manana will purchase construction materials and repair the house, which is old and damaged. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions. Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and renovate her house

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 49 years old. She is married to Robert, and together they have nine children. She sells cereals and has been in the business for the past one year.

She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase beans, green grams (a legume) and other cereals for stock in her shop.

She hopes to start selling cereals on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to purchase beans, green grams (a legume) and other cereals for stock in her shop.

loans.name: Montazer

texts.en:
Montazer is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 23 years, married and lives with four other family members, two of whom are employed. Montazer owns a shop for sanitary materials. He is also known for providing the service of water and sewer installation. He established his business in 2009 and now he has eight employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Montazer is requesting a $2400 Youth loan to renovate the office. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the office.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Olkalou, Kenya for the last 21 years. He is 54 years old, married to Mirriam, and they have five school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET, LTD. by a credit officer and this will be his fifth loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. 

James hopes to open a retail shop to boost his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 24 years old. He is married to Margaret, and together they have one child who is 4 years old. 

Douglas operates a beauty shop and a salon and has been in the business for the past one year.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our clients. He will use the loan amount to purchase beauty products. 

He hopes to purchase a plot of land and build a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Modesta is engaged in a food-vending business, selling snack foods to the people in her town. Modesta is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to buy ingredients to cook, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, and butter. In the future, Modesta wants to expand her current business and improve her family's way of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and butter

loans.name: Dania Group

texts.es:
Doña Camila es un miembro mas del grupo Dania, ella tiene la edad de 35 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casada con Don Ruben con el cual tiene 4 hijos, ella platica que desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar realizando las labores del hogar pero ella quería realizar una actividad la cual le dejara un poco de dinero para contribuir con los gastos de su hogar ya que cada día la situación económica esta peor y ningún dinero alcanza y hace 4 años con el apoyo de su esposo abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar la cual esta funcionando bien ya que tiene muchos clientes  ella dijo "ya tengo mi negocio siempre busco la manera de surtirla para que los clientes encuentren lo que necesiten y así con gusto regresan a comprar otro día", lo que mas le gusta de su actividad a Doña Camilla es que trata con la gente a diario y  atiende su negocio sin descuidar a su familia. Doña Camila invertirá este crédito en la compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, sal, aceite, dulces, refrescos, productos enlatados, arina, papel higiénico, pasta dental, para resurtir su negocio y continuar con sus ventas. Ella espera que a futuro este las ganancias que obtenga invertirlas en dar mantenimiento a su tienda y hacer algunas mejoras a su hogar.

Las demas integrantes de grupo son:

Georgina venta de refrescos
Mirna venta de refrescos
Grabriela venta de maíz y servicio de molino
Araceli venta de artículos para el hogar(toper)
Liliana venta de carne enchilada
Francisca venta de refrescos
Yanet venta de masa, maíz y tortillas
Valentina venta de dulces y refresco
texts.en:
Camila, 35 years old, is a member of the Dania group. She completed secondary school and is married to Ruben, with whom she has 4 children. She says that she learned to work at a very young age by completing household chores. However, she wanted to work at a job that would allow her a bit of money to contribute to household expenses since the financial situation became worse every day and there was not enough money. 

Four years ago, with her husband's help, she opened a small grocery store in her home. This has worked well because she has many customers. She said, "Now that I have my business, I always look for the best way to stock it so customers find what they need, and so they return to shop here again." The aspect Camila likes most about her work is working with people daily and attending to her business without neglecting her family.

Camila will invest this loan into buying rice, beans, sugar, salt, candy, drinks, canned goods, flour, toilet paper, and toothpaste to restock her business and continue her sales. She hopes that the profit she earns in the future will be invested into store maintenance and to home improvements.

The other members of the group are:

Georgina, who sells drinks
Mirna, who sells drinks
Grabriela, who sells corn and runs a mill
Araceli, who sells home items
Liliana, who sells enchilada meat
Francisca, who sells drinks
Yanet, who sells corn, corn paste, and tortillas
Valentina, who sells candy and drinks

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, cooking oil, candy, drinks, canned goods, flour, toilet paper, and toothpaste

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
Akil is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Akil owns a small cafeteria for fast food. He established his business in 2004 after a good experience in the fast food business. He has now one employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate the cafeteria and buy a grill. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the cafeteria and buy a grill.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 32 years old. She is married to Thiari, and together they have four children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past four years.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

She hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 32 years old. She is married to David, and together they have three children. Eunice operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, after she was introduced to KADET LTD, by a credit officer. She will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, soaps and flour to sell in her shop.

She hopes to expand her shop to sell wholesale items.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soaps and flour to stock her shop.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 36 years old. He single but supports his younger siblings who are in school. He is a tailor and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his second loan with KADET LTD. He repaid the previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase clothing material for use in his business. He was introduced to KADET LTD. by a client.

He hopes to purchase a plot of land and start farming.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 27 years old. He is married to Esther, a greengrocer, and together they have one child. Simon operates a motorcycle and has been in the business for the past nine years.

This will be Simon's second loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use this loan to purchase another motorcycle.

He hopes to purchase taxi vehicle in the near future.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 27 years old and single. He supports his school-going siblings. He operates a motorcycle for passenger  transport besides selling second-hand clothes. He has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to service his motorcycle and also use part of it to stock his second-hand clothes business.

He hopes to see his siblings complete their education.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. In 2003, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own business as a farmer. He cultivates seasonal fruits and vegetables. Ali has a wide variety of products, which he sells to customers from his town and the neighboring villages. In parallel, he has worked at a local company for many years.

Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase required agricultural tools and supplies, seeds and fertilizers. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage, which will lead to higher profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and expand his lands to include a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural tools and supplies, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 35-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and four children. With the cooperation of her husband, she is capable of satisfying her family's needs and offering them a fair way of living. She owns a small minimarket where she sells all kinds of dairy and day-to-day products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. As for her husband, he has been serving in the Lebanese army for 20 years. 

Today, Fatima is asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the necessary food provisions for her minimarket. In that way she will be able to diversify her items and increase her revenues and thus better her family’s way of living. One of her greatest dreams is to educate her children and see them achieve good positions.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions for her minimarket

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is from a small village of Keda district. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband and 30-year-old son. Her husband is provided with a retirement pension, and her son works as a manager of the village club-house. He gets a small monthly income. 

Natela runs an animal husbandry business. She has a milk cow, whose milk is sold locally. In addition, she owns a plot of land where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. The family does all relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. They sell their agricultural production at the local open market. Natela works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family. 

She requested a loan to purchase beehives with bee colonies. The family will get honey and plans to sell it in nearby villages. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies.

loans.name: Las Mojarritas Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es otro de los integrantes del grupo Las Mojarritas, es madre soltera de un pequeño que estudia la primaria, ella solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar la secundaria, Doña Margarita platica que sus padres se dedicaban a la pesca ya que viven en una comunidad que se ubica a orrilla de una laguna y la principal actividad economica es venta de mojarra.

ella crecio aprendiendo a pescar y actualmente ella vive de este trabajo, platica que todos los dias salen de pesca toda la mojarra que atrapan en el dia salen a venderla a las comunidades cercanas, ella tiene mas de 20 años en este negocio, ya  mucha gente la conoce y la van a buscar a su casa para acerle el gasto.

ella invertira este credito en la compra de redes, tendales y dar mantenimiento a su lancha.

Doña Margarita desea a futuro su negocio continue creciendomas y obtener mas clientes para que sus ganancias aunmenten poder seguir pagando los estudios de su hijo.

ella dijon "ahora si que gracias a la fundacion que viene hasta la comunidad a darme prestamos a mi y a mi gente con sus planes de pago nos ayudan de amonton, que Dios les de mas sigan ayudando"
 
los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Yocunda - venta de abarrotes
Maria - venta de pescado
Margarita Gomez - venta de abarrotes
Rafael - venta de pescado 
Maria Paula - venta de pollos 
Alejandra - venta de abarrotes 
Adela - venta de pescado 
Marcelino - venta de paletas heladas 
Angel Roberto - venta de pescado 
Maria - venta de pescado 
Jaqueline- venta de pescado
Luis -venta de abarrotes 
Yadira -venta de antojitos mexicanos
Guadalupe - venta de pescado
Patricia - venta de pescado
texts.en:
Margarita is one member of Las Mojarritas group. She is a single mother of a child who is studying primary school, she only had the opportunity to study through secondary school. Margarita says that her parents were engaged in fishing because they live in a community located at the shore of a lagoon, and the main economic activity is selling mojarra [a type of sea bream]. 

She grew up learning how to fish and currently she makes a living out of this work. She says that she goes to fish every day. Then, they go out to sell the mojarra they caught during the day to close communities. She has more than 20 years in this business, and many people know her and go to her house to buy.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of fishing nets, awnings, and in the maintenance of her boat. For the future, Margarita wishes her business to continue growing and to obtain more customers, so her profits will increase and she will be able to keep paying the studies of her son. She said "thanks to the foundation for coming to the community to give loans to me and my people. With its plans of payment they are helping a lot, God gives them more to keep helping".

The other members of the group are: 

Yocunda - selling groceries
Maria - selling fish
Margarita Gomez - selling groceries
Rafael - selling fish
Maria Paula - selling chickens
Alejandra - selling groceries
Adela - selling fish
Marcelino - selling popsicles
Angel Roberto - selling fish
Maria - selling fish
Jaqueline - selling fish
Luis-selling groceries
Yadira - selling Mexican snacks
Guadalupe - selling fish
Patricia - selling fish

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, awnings and in the maintenance of her boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and living with his parents. He, together with his father, is trying his best to bring added income to the family and enhance their way of living. 

Hussein has been working as a blacksmith since a few years ago. He owns a factory where he manufactures different types of metal upon request. He learned this profession from his father and is doing the best he can to better improve and develop himself. 

As he wants to enlarge his business and grow his work as well, he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way. He wishes to get married and have children; that's reasons why he’s in a real need to amplify his income in order to be able to make the needed savings for his wedding and future life plans.

loans.use: to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita de  54 anos de edad, madre soltera con  3 hijos todos mayores de edad, pertenece al departamento de león ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida desde hace  21 anos que tiene este negocio. Que ha sido su medio de vida y sus hijos como madre soltera para sacarlos adelante. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina diaria de María Margarita es comercializar su comida para el almuerzo de 11: am hasta 3: pm y para la cena de 5: pm hasta las 12: pm. La venta la realiza al contado y al crédito, ofreciéndola al vecindario, y personas que trabajan, y circulan en una gasolinera que esta ubicado cerca de su casa  ese punto de venta le ayuda mucho para obtener  mejores ganancias. En la actualidad el  problemas personal que enfrenta actualmente es la perdida del hijo mayor, para ella como madre ha sido muy doloroso y esta tratando de aceptar dicha perdida.  María Margarita ya ha trabajo con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad en sus pagos. El financiamiento lo quiere  para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar productos para elaborar sus comidas como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, condimentos, verduras, sazonadores, tortillas, pan, huevos, pollo, carne. La Sra. agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Margarita is 54 years old, is a single mother and has three children, all of them adults. She belongs to the department of León, located in the west of the country. Her economic actiity is the sale of food, she has had this business for 21 years. It has been the livelihood for her and her children, the way she gets ahead as a single mother. 

The business is located in her home. The daily routine of María Margarita is to sell her food for lunch, from 11am to 3pm, and for dinner, from 5pm to 12am. The sales are made by cash and on credit, offering it to neighbors and to people who work and walk in the gas station located close to her home. This point of sale is very helpful to obtain better profits. 

She currently faces a personal problem, which is the lost of her older son. As a mother, it has been very painful for her and she is trying to accept the loss. 

María Margarita has previously worked with the foundation and has demonstrated responsibility in her payments. She wants the financing to invest in working capital and to buy products for the elaboration of her foods such as rice, beans, oil, condiments, vegetables, seasonings, tortillas, bread, eggs, chicken, and beef. She appreciates the help provided by Kiva lenders to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so they can have decent means to work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital by buying products for the preparation of food such as rice, beans, oil, condiments, vegetables, seasonings, tortillas, bread, eggs, chicken, beef.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. Despite his young age, Hussein is obliged to work continually as he is responsible after his father for covering his family expenses and responding to their needs. 

He started his business in 2008 when he opened his own shoe shop. He provides his customers with good quality products at fair prices. He is satisfied with what he has attained so far, even though he wishes to enhance his way of living the most. 

That’s the reason of why he’s asking today for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of shoes. In the near future, Hussein wishes to open other branches and maybe hire new employees to help him achieve work tasks and therefore earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of shoes.

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es:
MIGUEL EDUARDO tiene 43 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijas, el vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.


ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS. 

MIGUEL EDUARDO  se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, polvillo, vacunas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para obtener una buena ganacia. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es es comprar una finca. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y escuchar música nacional.
texts.en:
Miguel Eduardo is 43 years old and is single. He has two daughters and lives with his parents in Ventanas, Los Rios province. 

He is a member of the communal bank "VRC Norte" which is located in the Ventanilla Norte area, part of the Ventanas canton. They earn their living through agriculture and fishing.

Miguel Eduardo earns his living through the purchase and resale of pigs. He is asking for this loan to buy pigs, rice-based animal feed and vaccines. With the help of this loan he will be able to buy what he needs to obtain a good income. 

He will make the purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to buy a finca. In his free time he likes to play and listen to the traditional music of his country.

loans.use: to buy pigs, rice-based animal feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Las Solteras Group

texts.es:
Las Solteras es un grupo integrado por 6 mujeres las cuales tienes muchas cosas en comun son trabajadoras, amables y estan solteras por eso decidieron poner este nombre a su grupo, esta ubicado en la comunidad de Caxapa en el cual una de la principales actividades es la recolección de resinas de arboles de hule.

Las integrantes de este grupo son: Nuria club de nutrición, María Francisca venta de antojitos, Blanca Lidia venta de refrescos, Magdalena venta de ropa, Brenda venta de abarrotes y Susana venta de antojitos

Brenda tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio la preparatoria y es soltera, ella platica que hace tres años abrio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ya que desde que dejo de estudiar habia buscado trabajo no encontro y penso en abrir una pequeña tienda en la cual ganara su propio dinero sin salir de casa y asi poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, ella  inicio con venta refrescos, dulces y poco a poco fue surtiendo con abarrotes y con el paso del tiempo su negocio a progresado, ella comenta que siempre da un buen trato a sus clientes ya que esto garantiza que vuelvan a comprar, un credito de Vision Fund dara a Brenda la oportunidad de comprar galletas, huevos, aceite, sal, azucar, arroz, frijol, cafe, especies, dulces, papel higiénico, rastrillos, servilletas, refrescos, saborisantes y productos enlatados para resurtir su negocio. Ella ha pensado que sus ganancias las continuara invirtiendo en su negocio ya que quiere verlo crecer mas y que sus ventas aumenten.
texts.en:
"Las Solteras" (The Single Ladies) is a group made up of six women who have many things in common. They are hard-working, friendly and single: that is why they decided to give the group this name. It is located in the community of Caxapa, where one of the main activities is collecting resins from hule trees. 

The members of this group are: Nuria (nutrition club), María Francisca (snack food sales), Blanca Lidia (soft drink sales), Magdalena (clothing sales), Brenda (grocery sales), and Susana (snack food sales).

Brenda is 25, went to high school, and is single.  She says that three years ago she opened a small grocery store, as since leaving school, she had looked for work, but did not find it. She thought about opening a small store, where she could earn her own money without leaving the house, and this way be able to help with the household expenses. 

She started off selling soft drinks and candy. Little by little she began to stock groceries, and over time her business has progressed. She says that she always gives her customers good service, as this ensures that that they shop there again. 

A Vision Fund loan will give Brenda the opportunity to buy cookies, eggs, cooking oil, salt, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, spices, candy, toilet paper, safety razors, napkins, soft drinks, flavorings and canned goods for restocking her store. 

She intends to continue investing her earnings in her business, as she wants to see it grow further and to see her sales increase.

loans.use: To buy cookies, eggs, cooking oil, salt, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, spices, candy, toilet paper, safety razors, napkins, soft drinks, flavorings and canned goods.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 41 years old, and a food stall owner in Kilifi. She is a married mother of two school going children. She has been selling food for the past five years. She also runs a carpentry workshop on the side to supplement her income.

This marks her third business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also for the expansion of her business. 

She hopes to excel in the business and create jobs for youths.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 39 years old, married to Winny and a father to three children. He operates a taxi in the Narok area and has been running the business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

He is servicing a second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET, and this will enable him to do a full service on his vehicle. He plans to use the profits to enlarge his business network. 

His future dream is to put more effort into his business, diversify into large-scale farming and better his living standards.

loans.use: To pay for a full service for his taxi

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 44 years old, married, and blessed with five children that he supports. He has been running a retail shop for the last seven years while getting a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has applied for a loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use for stocking for his shop with a variety of petroleum products. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his business. 

His dream is to educate his children and be successful in life.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop

loans.name: Njogu

texts.en: Njogu is a 42-year-old married man. He describes himself as honest and dependable. He operates a real estate business where he provides housing. His business is located within a slum area, and his primary customers are residents from the slum. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to pay for the renovation of the houses. His business goal is to own a taxi to start a new transportation business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his rental houses

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 32 years old and married to Maureen. They have been blessed with four children. Clement is in the motorcycle transport business, a business he has run for the last three years. His monthly income is KES 15,000.

He has currently applied for his second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET. This loan will help him to add to his savings and purchase an additional motorcycle, which he will employ someone else to operate. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest and increase his inventory. 

His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will enable him to improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. Over the years, he has had a lot of experience in working as a contractor. He works in his town and has multiple projects. He is capable to work independently.  He is highly professional and seeks better living conditions.
  
Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to renew his construction tools and purchase the needed materials for his new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy his clients and ensure a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to take construction projects outside of the country to further expand his business operations.

loans.use: To renew his construction tools and purchase the needed materials for his new project

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles  is a 27-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be a faithful, trustful and obedient man. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located within a viable market, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area and the high prices of clothes. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan to buy clothes for resale. His business goal is to run a wholesale clothes business within five years. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and his two children, who are attending school. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2008. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages, and he also makes private transportation trips upon client request. His business income is very important as he represents the only income source for the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his car, such as painting, repairing the body, etc. He notes that these repairs will make his transportation safer and will help him attract more clients. This is his first Kiva loan, and he hopes to be able to improve his business as well as his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car such as painting, repairing the body, etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 35 years old. He is married to Naoreen, and they are blessed with four children. He is a livestock keeper in the Narok area and has been in livestock farming for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He is servicing his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET that he plans to use to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. He intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his animals’ numbers and pay school fees for his children. 

His future dream is to prosper and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy a bull for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Mujeres del porvenir es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 7 personas cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con la intención de obtener mas recursos  y brindar a sus familia una mejor calidad de vida, las integrantes de este grupo son: Erika papelería, Elvira venta de calzado, Maribel venta de dulces, Flora venta de bisuteria, Elsa venta de calzado, María Ynés cría de cerdos y Rafaela cría de cerdos, este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad del porvenir y su gente se dedica al trabajo del campo.

Doña María Ynés tiene la edad de 54 años, solo estudio 2 años de primaria y esta casada con don Máximo, ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos desde hace 10 años, Doña María Ynés decidió iniciar con esta actividad porque quería tener la oportunidad de ganar su propio dinero desde su hogar sin desatender  a su esposo, ella platica que compra los cerdos desde pequeños con solo tres meses de nacidos, los inicia a cuidar y a engordar para cuando ya estén grandes y gordos poder venderlos y ver sus ganancias. Ella platica que invertirá este crédito en la compra de cerdos y alimentos. 

Ella desea que a futuro invertir sus ganancias en hacer una mejoras a su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Este grupo envió un saludo a las personas que hacen posible su crédito.
texts.en:
Mujeres Del Porvenir is the name of a group made up of seven people, each of whom has a business with the aim of earning more and offering their families a better quality of life.  The group's members are: Erika, who has a stationery store, Elvira, who sells shoes, Maribel, who sells candy, Flora, who sells costume jewelry, Elsa, who sells shoes, María Ynés, who raises pigs, and Rafaela, who raises pigs.  This group is located in the community of El Porvenir and its people work in the fields.

María Ynés is 54 years old.  She only studied through the second grade and she is married to Máximo.  She has been raising pigs for ten years.  María Ynés decided to start this business because she wanted the opportunity to make her own money from her home without neglecting her husband.  She tells us that she buys the pigs when they are only three months old, then she starts taking care of them and fattening them so that when they are big and fat she can sell them and make her profits.  She tells us that she will use this loan to buy pigs and feed.

In the future, she wants to use her earnings to make some improvements to her home and to have a better quality of life.

This group sends greetings to the people who make their loans possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

location.town: El Porvenir, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48 years old. He is married to Mary, and together they have four children. He operates a motorcycle for transport and has been in the business for the past five years.

This will be his second loan with KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

He hopes to own a plot of land where he can build his family a home.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is a Lebanese single man. He’s 22 years old. He’s really attached to his parents and sibling. Cooperating together, Tony and his family are capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. 

He started his business at an early age. He had to work really hard to prove that he’s a necessary support for his family. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new mechanic tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more customers. In the future, he plans to open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to buy new mechanic tools for his business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old. He is married to Emily, and they are blessed with five children. He operates a motorcycle transport business and has been running the business for the last five years. His monthly income is 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is servicing his first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET, and this will assist him to repair his broken motorcycle. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest and increase his inventory. 

His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will make him improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Isata from Moriba town in a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 years and 7 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2000, Isata established her palm oil business within a busy market area. She began her business because her parent taught her business -- it is the only thing she understands better. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Isata requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her life. In the future, Isata plans to own a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy palm oil to resell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 46 year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of four and fifteen. All of his children go to school.

Joseph runs a manufacturing company and has been in this business for five years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through his clients. He is requesting a loan of 4000 SDG to purchase clothes, shoes and many others. In addition to this business, Joseph has no other source of income.

In five years Joseph would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices.

Joseph says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva's help.

loans.use: to buy more metal to make beds,  etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 27 años tiene un negocio, mediante el cual fábrica bloques, desde hace 5 años. En su blockera, vende a clientes particulares, contratistas, y actualmente suministra bloques para un centro recreacional, que cada vez mas  aumenta sus pedidos; en su negocio se desarrolla el proceso de preparación, mezcla, vaciado en moldes secado; las ventas las realiza de contado, de lunes a sábado y también compra los materiales de esta misma manera, en  Ferreterías ubicadas en el municipio de Malambo, donde habita y tiene su negocio;  su  mercado objetivo son las ferreterías, por eso su  metas es la de incrementar el volumen de producción y la de captar la atención de un mayor número de ferreterías como clientes fijos. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograr una mayor producción y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará   cemento, arena y moldes; con esta inversión logrará tener un mayor inventario de blockes y así mismo incrementar la oferta, lo cual constituye el éxito de su credikiva..
texts.en:
María, 27, has been in the brick making business for five years.  She sells to private customers and contractors, and also supplies blocks to a recreational center that is constantly increasing its orders.  Her business consists of the process of preparation, mixing and pouring material into dry molds.  Her sales are transacted in cash and she works Monday through Saturday.  She also buys her materials in cash at hardware stores in the town of Malambo where she lives and her business is located.  Her target market are hardware stores, so her goal is to increase her production volume to attract as many as she can as fixed customers.  

Her greatest difficulty is the lack of working capital to increase production and sales.  This is the reason she is requesting her first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy cement, sand and molds.  With this investment she will be able to increase her stock of blocks and increase her offer, making her CrediKiva successful.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and molds.

loans.name: Emiro

texts.es: Emiro tiene 57 años,  es un hombre casado, que tiene 2 hijos de 29 y 18 años y 1 hija de 27 años con quienes sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Emiro se dedica a  la  venta de pescado, en un bicicarro en el cual lo distribuye, desde hace 23 años, cuando ideo este negocio después de trabajar durante 10 años en una empresa textil, y una vez dejó de hacerlo, con su liquidación comenzó a invertirlo en pescado y a ofrecerle a sus vecinos; hoy en el sector es muy reconocido, porque vende toda clase de pescado directamente a los clientes, de contado y a un crédito con un plazo máximo de 8 días: Emiro desde los Martes hasta los Domingos, hace sus compras de contado, en el mercado de Barranquilla. Sus metas del negocio es adquirir un nuevo bicicarro e incrementar el volumen de compras de pescado y aumentar  sus ventas, para lograr adecuaciones a su vivienda y construir en un lote que acaba de comprar; no obstante a sus sueños tiene un gran desafío y es el no contar con el  capital  de trabajo suficiente para lograr rápidamente sus sueños. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará pescado como  en Bocachico, mojarra, bagre, camarones y arreglar el biciicarro en que distribuye su pescado; con esta inversión logrará un mejor surtido para poder ampliar su clientela y poco a poco alcanzar sus  tan anheladas metas.
texts.en:
Emiro, 57, is married and has two son, ages 29 and 18, and a daughter, aged 27, who he wants to become successful people.  For 23 years Emiro has been selling fish and distributing it using a bike-cart.  He decided to go into business after working in a textile factory for ten years.  He used the severance pay he received to buy fish and sell it to his neighbors.  Nowadays, he is very well-known in the industry because he sells all kinds of fish directly to the customers, on both a cash and 8-day credit basis.  He works Tuesday through Sunday and makes his purchases in cash at the Barranquilla market.  

His business goal is to buy a new bike-cart and increase his fish purchases to increase sales.  This is so he can renovate his house and build on a lot he just bought.  But, despite his dreams, he is up against a great challenge, which is not having enough working capital to make his dreams come true.  Therefore, he is requesting a CrediKiva loan to buy fish, such as lizardfish, sea fish, catfish and shrimp; and also to fix the bike-cart he uses to distribute the fish.  Through this investment he will be able to increase his variety and attract more customers, little by little allowing him to reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy lizardfish, sea fish, catfish and shrimp; and to fix the bike-cart he uses to distribute his fish.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María de 63 anos de edad, casada con 5 hijos mayores de edad, del municipio de Malpaisillo, tiene por actividad económica destace de cerdos  y venta de ganado, desde hace 20 anos que se desempeña en dicha actividad. La rutina de Rosa María es salir a comprar cerdos en las comunidades aledañas para comprar cerdos y destazarlo y vender los productos derivados del mismo como: la carne, chicharon, charrasca, frito, adobado, chingaste, moronga. Toda comida típica de nuestro país. En la actualidad ya se ha establecidos con sus clientes los cuales tiene clientes fijos y eventuales. El financiamiento  lo necesita para comprar cerdos en pie y poder ofrecer mejor y mayor productos a sus clientes. Rosa María agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 63, is married and has five adult children, and lives in the town of Malpaisillo.  For 20 years she has been in business as a pork butcher.  Rosa María buys pigs in the neighboring communities, which she butchers and sells as meat, pork rinds, fried pork, and other typical dishes of the country.  Most of the customers she sells to have their own fixed and eventual customers.

She needs the loan to buy pigs so she can offer more volume and better products to her customers.  Rosa maría is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy pigs to sell pork meat, pork rinds, fried pork, and all kinds of typical dishes.

loans.name: David Ivan

texts.es:
DAVID IVAN tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los abuelitos en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS. 

DAVID IVAN se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas al cultivo de ciclo corto de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.
solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos y polvillo. con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los cerdos y la alimentación para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos a un mejor precio. 

las conpras y las ventas de los animales lo harán en la ciudad de ventanas. El sueño es mejorar los ingresos, prosperar ser totalmente independiente.
 
los desafios es poder criar a los cerdos. en el tiempo libre le gusta jugar.
texts.en:
David Ivan, 20, is single and has no children.  He lives with his grandparents in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the communal bank Norte, which is located in the Ventanilla Norte community, in Ventanas Canton, which is involved mainly in agriculture and livestock farming.

David Ivan grows short-cycle maize and raises pigs.  He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed.  The loan will allow him to raise, feed and sell the pigs at a good price.

He buys and sells the livestock in the city of Ventanas.  His goal is to increase his income and become totally independent.  His most difficult challenge is raising the pigs.  In his free time he enjoys recreational activity.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Gugnara J Nicaragua

texts.es:
Gugnara es una mujer de 50 años, cursó la educación primaria, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos adultos. Ella vive en Quinindé un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón lo que ha permitido un gran movimiento comercial en especial los fines de semana en donde salen comerciantes de todo tipo a ofertar sus productos en la feria a sus potenciales clientes que la mayoría de veces suelen ser campesinos. El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad.
Gugnara tiene un restaurante desde hace 16 años al cual le dedica 8 a 9 horas cada día que por lo general son en la tarde y gran parte de la noche. Cada año ella ha visto que sus clientes son más y es por eso que el local en donde actualmente atiende ya no abastece la demanda de sus clientes, es por eso que ahora Gugnara piensa ampliar el lugar aumentando algo de mesas y espacios para dar la mejor atención a sus clientes. Por esta razón esta mujer trabajadora y esforzada solicitó un préstamo que le permita comprar estos activos y que de esta forma sus ingresos incrementen y poder mejorar su estilo de vida y tener un ahorro para salud y bienestar de sus años de vejez.
texts.en:
Gugnara, 50, has an elementary education, is single and has three adult children.  She lives in Quinindé, a canton of the province of Esmeraldas which supplies several cities of Ecuador with products such as bananas, cocoa, café, African palm and forest products.  Commerce is the daily work for most of the inhabitants to be able to get ahead, especially now that roads to this canton permit much trade movement on weekends when merchants go to the markets to seek potential customers, most of which are farmers.
