Zolia is 31 years old and a member of the “Hogar de Niños” group.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband works in a sawmill.  Her children attend school and she is a hardworking, honest person.  Zoila began her business three years ago, starting with a food stall.  She currently sells new clothes and sandals.  She learned this business from her sister, since she has a clothing store.  She works from 8:00am to 4:00pm.  She works on foot and goes out to sell in the different neighborhoods in her community.  An advantage is that she has many customers and a disadvantage is that she has to pay rent for her home.

Zolia needs this loan to invest in new clothing and sandals of different types that are in style, to attract her customers’ attention.  Her business will change to help her business and expand it.  Her earnings will allow her to help her feed her children and pay expenses.  One of her dreams is to set up a shop so that she will no longer have to sell on foot.  She would also like a home of her own.  She has been getting FAMA’s support for two years and has repaid her loans on time.  They have helped her improve her life and her business has grown.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en: Eladia is from the community of Loon, in the province of Bohol. She is 67 years old and has been in a retail business, selling basic household items like grocery needs. She sells canned goods, seasoning, soft drinks, rice, snack foods and also owns an eatery. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of soft drinks, seasoning, coffee, vinegar, rice, cooking oil and canned goods. In the future, Eladia hopes to continue her business, making it more sustainable and prosperous.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Om-Akhlaq Group

texts.en: The group Om-Akhlaq is comprised of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. The group's representative, Asma, is the one in the photo who appears from the right screen. Asma dropped out of primary school. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. She has a house and would like to renew her house. So, she applied for a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to enroll her children into private schools and work in manual labor.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 29 years old, married and has two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is bachelor.  Mohammed lives in a leased house and would like to buy furniture for his bedroom, so he applied for a youth loan from AMB. He hopes to own a house in order to dispense with rent payments.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his bedroom.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 40 years old, married and has four children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a house and he would like to buy furniture. He is asking for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 32 years old and is from Sana`a, Yemen. He is married and has only one child. He lives in a small house which he wishes to offer for his family's pleasant life. He is asking for a loan of 120,000 YER to buy a T.V. and kitchen utensils. He hopes to open a business store so that he gets profits and enrolls his child in a private school.

loans.use: to buy a T.V. and kitchen utensils for his house

loans.name: Al-Atf Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Atf which consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER.

Fathia is the leader of this group. She is the woman seated in the middle. She is 30 years old, married and has six children who live in Taiz. She has a small house. She would like to renew her house, so she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials, such as cement, etc., and to buy house furniture. She hopes to have a big building and hire it for people.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, etc. and to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 19-year-old, single young man. He has a mobile phone store for selling mobile phones and their accessories, and also for maintaining mobile phones to customers. Khalil's project has been a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but it also needs more support to cover the costs.

Khalil is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of mobile phones and their accessories and a new maintaining kit for his store. This will allow him to offer a better selection for his customers to buy and improve the quality of his work, which will improve his income positively and ensure him a bright future. Khalil is photographed in his store. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of mobile phones and accessories and a new maintaining kit

loans.name: Al-Tkafl Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tkafl which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They work hard as much they can to offer a good life for their families. They took out a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Khyriah is the leader of this group. She is the woman seated in the middle. She is 30 years old, married and has four children. She is a housewife who wishes her children to grow up well and learn better education. She intends to buy supplies for her house so she applied for a youth loan of 55,000 YER to buy kitchen appliances for her house. She hopes to buy electrical materials to live comfortable with her children.

loans.use: to buy kitchen appliances for her house.

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Elene is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Esperanza (love and hope) 1, 2, 3 & 4. This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She is a widow mother. She says that her dream is to have her own house, and thanks to the loan and her savings, she had made it possible to start building it.

Elene is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 16 years, starting to sell products before she moved to the Dominican Republic. Elene plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She will also use future profits to reinvest in her business and to finish building her house. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Mujeres De Sueños Y Metas 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Mujeres De Sueños y Metas (Women of Dreams and Goals ) 5, 6 & 7 group. This group is comprised of 15 women with small businesses who sell different products. Aurelia is the mother of a child and she lives together with her long term partner. They live in the city of Santo Domingo. She has always worked hard to give her children what she was not able to have in her childhood.

Aurelia’s business is a Fantasia, a miscellaneous products shop. She sells different products, like cosmetics and women's accessories. This is her 4th loan with Esperanza Internancional. She is very grateful because she has been able to advance and invest in her business with the loans. She will use this new loan to increase her business inventory. 

This group is located in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo. It is to the north of the city.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Las Dalias Group

texts.es:
La Joven Tania es otro de los integrantes del grupo Las Dalias, ella tiene la edad de 19 años, es soltera y solo estudio la preparatoria, Tania platica que desde muy pequeña su mama le enseño a trabajar en la venta de frutas y verduras ya que en su familia la han realizado esta actividad por mas de 15 años, ella  platica que al terminar de estudiar la preparatoria tenia que buscar un trabajo para poder contribuir con el gasto de su hogar y dice que junto a su mama decidieron poner un pequeño puesto de frutas a orilla de la carretera, en el cual no solo venden fruta sino también realizan cócteles, jugos y venta de miel, ella ya tiene varios años con su negocio y le va muy bien ya que ha ganado clientes y siempre trata de surtir su puesto con fruta de temporada lo cual ayuda a que sus ventas aumenten, Tania dice que se vende mas en tiempo de zafra(cuando los ingenios producen azúcar) por hay un poco mas de dinero. Un crédito de VisionFund dará a Tania la oportunidad de comprar variedad de fruta de temporada como sandia, melón, piña, papaya, plátano, naranja, mandarinas. Ella desea que con esta inversión su negocio continué progresando y poder ofrecer a su mama y hermanos una mejor calidad de vida.

El Grupo Las Dalia agradece el apoyo que se les esta brindando por medio de estos  créditos. 

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Fabiola venta de cosmeticos
Marcela venta de tamales
Imelda venta de comida y gelatinas
Nieves venta y elaboracion de pan
Rosa María venta de calzado
Jova venta de calzado
María del Carmen venta de refrescos
texts.en:
Tania is another of the members of Las Dalias group.  She is 19 years old, is single and only studied at a single school. Tania says that when she was very little her mother taught her to work selling fruit and vegetables since in her family they have been doing this for more than 15 years.  

She says that when she finished her studies she had to look for a job so that she could contribute toward household expenses and she says that with her mother they decided to set up a small fruit stand along the main road, in which they sell not only fruit but also make and sell cocktails, juices and honey.  She already has had a number of years running her business and it is going very well since she has increased the number of customers and she always tries to stock her stand with seasonal fruit, which help increase her sales.  Tania says that she sells more during the season of zafra (when the indigenous people produce sugar) in order to make a little more money.  

A credit from VisionFund will give Tania the opportunity to buy a variety of seasonal fruit such as watermelon, melon, pineapples, papaya, bananas, oranges and mandarines.  She hopes that with this investment her business will continue to grow and she will be able to offer her mother and siblings a better quality of life.  El Grupo Las Dalia appreciates the support that they are getting through these loans.  

The other members of the group are:

Fabiola, who sells cosmetics
Marcela, who sells tamales
Imelda, who sells food and jellies
Nieves, who makes and sells bread
Rosa María, who sells footwear
Jova, who sells footwear
María del Carmen, who sells refreshments

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Eyad appears in her Kiva profile photo and has the picture next to his stall.

Mona is a Palestinian young woman, she is married with no children yet. For the past 2 years, Mona's husband has had a stall selling roasted peanuts and different types of sweets, which is located in a good movement area and near to local schools. It is the only source of income to the family, which needs more support to cover the costs. Mona is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more roasted peanuts and sweets that customers often request and buy. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more roasted peanuts and sweets for sale

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a car hire company which he has been operating for 7 years. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high fuel and transport costs, price fluctuations and inflation. 

Nathan is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to service one of his vehicles. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his savings. His dream is to see his business grow and open other branches in other areas.

loans.use: To service one of his vehicles.

loans.name: Salaam

texts.en:
Salaam is from a village in northern Israel. She started providing haircuts and cosmetic treatments from her home. Two years ago she opened her salon outside of her home, registered her business and has steadily grown. In her town, there is a high demand for additional cosmetic treatments and Salaam is taking this opportunity to expand. Salaam has been trained in cosmetic treatments and hair styling.

She needed this loan to assist with purchasing a hair removal treatment machine and cosmetic supplies.

Salaam wants to continue and expand her salon in order to become financially stronger, providing a secure future for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy a hair removal treatment machine and cosmetic supplies.

loans.name: Widad

texts.en: Widad, who appears in the picture, is a 38-year-old single woman. She is a school teacher who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover her costs of living. Widad is completing her studying at the university, specializing in Arabic Language. Widad wants to complete her studies by paying the university fees, so she is requesting a $1,500 US loan from FATEN to help her cover the university fees. This will improve her salary at work and ensure a better future for her and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Mwatao

texts.en:
Mwatao lives in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. Mwatao owns a barber shop which has been in operation for two years. He received the capital from a contribution by family members. He also intends to set up a salon.

Mwatao was introduced to Milango by a friend and is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenya shillings to purchase materials for the salon such as driers, basins, shampoos, etc.. Mwatao believes the income from this loan will help him purchase the other equipment needed for the salon. His future ambition is to own a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the salon such as driers, basins, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a father of four children. He owns a restaurant, a business that he has been operating for 3 years. He started the business through his personal savings.

Francis learned about Milango through friends, who invited him to the group. He joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. Francis is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to buy cooking oil and potatoes wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase on his savings. His future plan is to open a ration store.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop – a business that he has been operating for seven years. His main challenge is taxes. 

Stanley learnt about Milango from an employee who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Stanley is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, sodas and detergents wholesale. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his savings. His dream is to open a wholesale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a tailoring business which she has been operating for six years. Her main challenges are customers not paying on time and finding customers. Her dream is to be the leading tailor in the area by acquiring more school tenders for school uniforms.

Esther learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Esther is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to buy material and an electric sewing machine. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for the business.
